translation.en: [man] What's up, Stutz? [Stutz] Hi, Jonah.
-[Stutz] Okay, entertain me. -[both laugh]
[Jonah] That's actually what you say when I sit down.
It's what I say to everybody.
Yeah, when we have a therapy session that's not filmed for a movie.
translation.ko: 영화 촬영이 아니라 상담 시간이니 그렇겠죠

translation.en: The… the other thing you… you say that always cracks me up, which is great,
translation.ko: 선생님 단골 멘트 중에 매번 웃기는 게 또 있어요

translation.en: is, "You better not come in here and dump all your shit on me."
No, yeah, you know, you've been dumping it on me for years, and I'm tired.
translation.ko: 몇 년째 와서 죽는소리만 하니 지겨워서 그래요

translation.en: Well, here we are.
Why do you think I'm making this movie about you?
translation.ko: 제가 왜 이 영화를 찍는 것 같으세요?

translation.en: I think it's… it's my ideas.
I… I think my ideas had an effect on you,
and I think you wanted to expose other people to the ideas.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들에게도 전파하고 싶은 거 아닐까요?

translation.en: And maybe…
I don't know, maybe it's just an attempt to gain control over me, or…
translation.ko: 글쎄요, 날 좌지우지하려고 수를 쓰는 것 같기도 하고…

translation.en: I'm not sure. Why did you?
Yeah, I have decided to make this because I want to present your tools
translation.ko: 선생님의 '툴'을 소개하고 싶어서 이 영화를 만들기로 마음먹었어요

translation.en: and the teachings of you, Phil Stutz, my therapist,
translation.ko: 제 심리 치료사이신 필 스터츠 선생님의 가르침을 전하려고요

translation.en: in a way that allows people to access them
translation.ko: 선생님이 말씀하시는 방법 그 툴을 활용함으로써

translation.en: and use them to make their own life better.
translation.ko: 다른 이들의 삶도 나아지길 바라는 마음에서요

translation.en: So I thought we would just film one session in one day
translation.ko: 그래서 오늘 자 상담 시간을 촬영하면서

translation.en: and cover some of your tools that have been most helpful for me in my life.
translation.ko: 제 삶에 제일 도움이 된 선생님의 툴을 소개하려 했죠

translation.en: I think that's good.
And do it in a way that also honors,
um, the life of somebody that I deeply care about and respect.
translation.ko: 제가 진심으로 좋아하고 존경하는 분의 삶을 기리는 거죠

translation.en: Okay.
But can you be funny once in a while? Just…
[Jonah] What's usually the first question you ask a new patient?
The first thing I ask them is, "What do you want? Why are you here?"
translation.ko: 첫 번째 질문은 이거예요 '여긴 왜 오셨어요?'

translation.en: The average shrink will say, "Don't intrude on the patient's process."
translation.ko: 일반 정신과 의사라면 환자를 방해하지 말라고 하겠죠

translation.en: "They will come up with the answers when they're ready."
That sucks. That's not acceptable.
translation.ko: 난 짜증 나서 그렇게는 못 해요

translation.en: When I got into psychiatry, the model was, "I'm neutral."
translation.ko: 내가 정신 의학을 배울 때는 중립을 지켜야 했죠

translation.en: "I'm just watching. I have no dog in this fight."
translation.ko: 관찰만 하는 거예요 어떤 상황에도 흔들림 없이

translation.en: It was a very slow process, and there was a lot of suffering.
translation.ko: 이 방법은 너무나 더뎠어요 매우 고통스러웠죠

translation.en: You know me, my reaction will be,
"Then go fuck yourself. Are you kidding me?"
If I'm dealing with someone with depression like that, who's afraid won't recover,
translation.ko: 우울증이 있는데 벗어나길 겁내는 환자가 있다면

translation.en: I say, "Do what the fuck I tell you. Do exactly what I tell you."
translation.ko: 난 내가 시키는 대로 무조건 하라고 해요

translation.en: "I guarantee you'll feel better. Guarantee, 100%. It's on me."
[Jonah] When I walked into your office, we sat down,
translation.ko: 제가 상담실에 와서 마주 보고 앉았을 때

translation.en: and you were just like, "Here's what you should do."
translation.ko: 선생님은 그냥 이러셨죠 '해야 할 일을 알려줄게요'

translation.en: You gave me some form of action. You gave me a tool.
translation.ko: 어떤 행동을 해야 할지 일종의 툴을 알려주셨어요

translation.en: Yeah, it's… it's imperative.
I wanted speed in this.
Not speed to cure somebody in a week. That's impossible.
translation.ko: 환자를 일주일 만에 치료하는 거야 불가능하지만

translation.en: But I wanted them to feel some change,
some forward motion.
It gives them hope. It's like, "Oh, shit, that's actually possible."
translation.ko: 그럼 실제로 바뀔 수 있겠다는 희망이 생기거든요

translation.en: So what are the tools?
A tool is something that can change your state, your inner state,
translation.ko: 본인의 마음 상태를 바꿀 수 있는 도구죠

translation.en: immediately, in real time.
It takes an experience that's normally unpleasant,
then it turns it into an opportunity.
Tools change your mood
and then just give you a sense of hope that that won't be your mood forever.
translation.ko: 이 기분이 영원하지 않을 거라는 희망을 얻는 거군요

translation.en: [Stutz] That's correct.
[Jonah] It's basically a real-time visualization exercise
you do in your head at that moment.
Yeah. So in that sense, I'm a teacher.
I'm teaching the person how to use it and also teach them when to do it.
translation.ko: 그 툴을 어떻게 활용하고 언제 쓸지 알려주니까요

translation.en: All of your patients, myself included, we have all these note cards.
translation.ko: 저를 포함해서 모든 환자가 메모 카드를 받아 가죠

translation.en: [Jonah] And they're drawings of the tools that you do in our sessions
that we take home and keep.
[Stutz] I tend to think in visual terms.
So I started drawing these cards really for myself,
translation.ko: 그래서 이 메모 카드를 그리기 시작했는데

translation.en: but it helped the patients tremendously.
The power of the cards is that they turn big ideas into simple images.
translation.ko: 이 카드의 위력은 거창한 생각을 단순한 그림으로 표현하는 거죠

translation.en: It was a way of communicating with the patient
that I actually felt was more powerful than using words.
translation.ko: 말보다 효과가 좋다는 걸 직접 체감했어요

translation.en: The moment they take out the card,
there's a connection between the two of us. There's a bond.
Yeah, we have a uniquely personal relationship.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 저랑 선생님도 아주 특별한 관계잖아요

translation.en: So much so that you're letting me make a film about you.
That is something I've never experienced in the therapeutic world.
translation.ko: 심리 치료를 하면서 이런 경험은 처음이었어요

translation.en: And, ultimately, my life has gotten immeasurably better as a result of working with you,
translation.ko: 선생님과 상담하면서 궁극적으로 제 삶이 훨씬 나아졌거든요

translation.en: and so, if it worked for me, maybe it will work for other people.
translation.ko: 그러니 다른 사람에게도 효과가 있을까 해서요

translation.en: Oh, yeah. Time for medicine.
-Time for what? -[Jonah] Time to take your medicine.
-Oh, thanks. -[Jonah] The alarm went off.
[Stutz] Oh, shit.
Jonah, you want to do some Parkinson's drugs with me?
I kicked the stuff years ago, man.
[Stutz] You know, when I was a kid, when I was using drugs,
translation.ko: 내가 어렸을 때 말이에요 젊어서 마약을 할 때

translation.en: if you ever told me, "50 years hence you'd be taking all this medicine…"
translation.ko: 50년 후에 이 많은 약을 먹게 될 거라고 말해 줬더라면…

translation.en: So that's all medicine for your Parkinson's?
Yeah.
With Parkinson's, the biggest thing is, and there's something good about this,
translation.ko: 파킨슨병에 걸리면 좋은 게 몇 가지 있는데요

translation.en: you have to preplan a lot of little things.
translation.ko: 일단 갖가지 자잘한 일을 미리 계획해야 해요

translation.en: When I have to get out of bed,
I have to go through contortions to get out of the bed.
translation.ko: 뒤틀린 몸을 달래 가며 일어나야 하죠

translation.en: The hardest thing for me in life is getting out of bed in the morning.
translation.ko: 저도 아침에 일어나는 게 인생에서 제일 힘들어요

translation.en: -But for very different reasons. -For different… [chuckles] Yeah.
translation.ko: - 이유는 많이 다르지만요 - 많이 다르죠 그러네요

translation.en: So, before meeting you, my experience with therapy was very traditional
translation.ko: 선생님을 만나기 전에는 전통적인 심리 치료만 해봤어요

translation.en: in the sense of I would be talking
and the person would say, "How does that feel?" -Or, "Interesting." [laughs] -[Stutz] Right.
translation.ko: 대개 기분이 어떠냐는 둥 흥미롭다고 이야기하시죠

translation.en: Basically keeping me at a massive distance.
Yeah. [Jonah] And I was thinking about how, in traditional therapy,
translation.ko: 전통적인 심리 치료가 어땠는지 생각해 보면요

translation.en: you're paying this person, and you save all of your problems for them,
translation.ko: 심리 치료사에게 돈을 내고 제 문제를 전부 말해봤자

translation.en: and they just listen,
and your friends, who are idiots,
give you advice.
-[Stutz] Yes. -Unsolicited.
-[Stutz] Yes. -And you want your friends just to listen.
translation.ko: - 그렇군요 - 친구는 그냥 들어 줬으면 싶고

translation.en: And you want your therapist to give you advice.
translation.ko: 심리 치료사는 조언을 해줬으면 싶은데 말이죠

translation.en: Here's the thing. The shrinks, it's not that they don't want to help you.
translation.ko: 정신과 의사는 환자를 돕고 싶은 마음이 없는 건 아니에요

translation.en: It's really not.
But for me, I always felt there was something missing.
translation.ko: 하지만 난 항상 뭔가 결여됐다고 느꼈어요

translation.en: So a tool is a bridge
between what you realize the problem is and the cause of the problem
translation.ko: 스스로 문제가 무엇인지 문제의 원인을 파악하고

translation.en: to over here,
actually gaining at least some control over the symptom.
It all has to do with possibility.
And not a bullshit definition of possibility.
Possibility means you feel yourself reacting differently.
translation.ko: 내가 다르게 대응할 수 있다고 느끼는 게 바로 가능성이죠

translation.en: It sounds, um…
What do you call it? Trite. But it's actually the truth.
translation.ko: 뭐랄까, 진부한 말 같지만 이게 진실이에요

translation.en: [Jonah] One of the first things you got me working on was my life force.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 과제로 삶의 원동력을 찾으라고 하셨죠

translation.en: That was such an immediate thing that can change your life
translation.ko: 덕분에 즉각적으로 인생을 바꿀 수 있었어요

translation.en: and something that I think anyone can easily latch onto.
translation.ko: 누구든 쉽게 이해할 수 있는 개념이라고 생각해요

translation.en: And it was the first step for me
in beginning the process of getting better.
Yeah, that's correct. Here's the classic thing that happens.
A guy's depressed, he comes into my office, and he says,
translation.ko: 우울감에 빠진 남자가 날 찾아와서 이렇게 말해요

translation.en: "I know my habits are shit." "I… I… I know I'm undisciplined. I know I'm lazy."
translation.ko: '전 못된 버릇이 들었어요 제멋대로에 게으르기 짝이 없죠'

translation.en: "But if I only knew what I was supposed to be doing,
what my mission was in life, essentially, I'd be like I was shot out of a gun."
translation.ko: '인생의 목적이 뭔지 안다면 정말 열심히 노력할 거예요'

translation.en: "But I don't know what I'm supposed to be doing,
translation.ko: '근데 뭘 해야 할지 알 수 없으니'

translation.en: so I'm just gonna be lazy and do nothing."
Then, from that, obviously comes the depression.
There's something that… that will apply to you
translation.ko: 조나에게 적용할 만한 좋은 툴이 있어요

translation.en: and to anybody else who doesn't have a sense of direction
translation.ko: 누구에게나 적용할 수 있죠 목적의식이 없거나

translation.en: or doesn't know what they should do next,
and the answer is, you can always work on your life force.
translation.ko: 그런 분들은 삶의 원동력을 찾는 게 늘 도움이 돼요

translation.en: The only way to find out what you should be doing, like who you are,
translation.ko: 자신이 뭘 해야 할지 자기 정체성을 알아낼 방법은

translation.en: is to activate your life force,
because your life force is the only part of you
that actually is capable of guiding you when you're lost.
translation.ko: 길 잃은 나 자신을 안내해 줄 수 있거든요

translation.en: If you think of it as a pyramid, there's three levels of the life force.
translation.ko: 피라미드로 그려 본 삶의 원동력은 3단계로 이뤄져요

translation.en: The bottom level is your relationship with your physical body.
translation.ko: 가장 밑에 있는 단계는 내 육체와의 관계예요

translation.en: The second layer is your relationship with other people.
translation.ko: 두 번째 단계는 다른 사람과의 관계죠

translation.en: And the highest level is your relationship with yourself.
translation.ko: 그리고 가장 높은 단계가 자신과의 관계예요

translation.en: The bottom step is your relationship to your physical body.
translation.ko: 맨 밑에 있는 단계 내 육체와의 관계에서는

translation.en: All you gotta do is get your body working better, and it always works.
translation.ko: 몸이 잘 돌아가게만 하면 돼요 이건 늘 효과 만점이에요

translation.en: The most classic thing is they're not exercising.
translation.ko: 대표적인 문제가 운동을 안 하는 거죠

translation.en: Diet is another one,
and sleeping.
So what percentage of that stuff
translation.ko: 우선 그런 육체적인 문제를 해결하고 나면

translation.en: is what makes you actually feel better at first?
Well, when it starts out,
it's probably 85%.
It's very high.
[Jonah] How fucking crazy is that?
When I was a kid,
exercise and diet was framed to me in like,
translation.ko: 고정관념이 있었죠 운동과 식이 요법을 못 해서

translation.en: "There's something wrong with how you look."
But never once was exercise or diet
translation.ko: 근데 단 한 번도 운동이나 식이 요법이

translation.en: propositioned to me in terms of mental health.
translation.ko: 정신 건강과 밀접하다는 생각은 못 했어요

translation.en: I just wish that was presented to people differently.
translation.ko: 그저 사람들에게 달라 보이고 싶은 마음뿐이었죠

translation.en: Yeah.
[Jonah] Because, for me,
that caused a lot of problems
and even problems with me and my mom.
I really met her, like, with an attitude of,
translation.ko: 엄마만 만나면 꼴 보기 싫다는 태도였어요

translation.en: "Fuck you, I don't want to do that, because you're saying there's something wrong with me."
translation.ko: 나한테 문제가 있다고 하니 늘 어깃장을 놨죠

translation.en: Yeah? Explain that.
Um, I can, but I'm not gonna go into it, 'cause this movie is about you, not me.
translation.ko: 말씀드릴 순 있지만 안 할래요 이 영화 주인공은 선생님이니까요

translation.en: But what if I said the more you elaborate on it,
the easier it's gonna be for me to take some chances.
translation.ko: 나도 더 마음 편히 내 이야기를 할 수 있어요

translation.en: Did you ever think of it like that?
I would say you should make a movie about me,
instead of me making a movie about you.
translation.ko: 제가 선생님 영화를 만들 게 아니라

translation.en: Yeah, that's a good one.
Okay. So that's the first level.
The next one is your relationship to other people,
'cause when people get depressed, it's not that they end their relationships.
translation.ko: 사람은 우울해지면 인간관계를 끝내는 게 아니라

translation.en: It's like a ship disappearing over the horizon.
They start to get pulled back, away from their life,
and relationships are like--
You know those things when you're climbing a mountain, pounding those pitons,
translation.ko: 산을 오를 때 바위틈에 박는 하켄 있잖아요

translation.en: it's like a handhold.
So your relationships are like handholds to let yourself get pulled back into life.
translation.ko: 인간관계는 삶으로 다시 돌아갈 때 잡을 수 있는 손잡이 역할을 하죠

translation.en: The key of it is you have to take the initiative.
If you're waiting for them to the take the initiative, you don't understand.
translation.ko: 마냥 기다려선 기회를 포착할 수 없죠

translation.en: You could invite somebody out to lunch that you don't find interesting,
translation.ko: 별 흥미 없더라도 점심 약속을 잡는 것도 방법이에요

translation.en: it doesn't matter, it will affect you anyway, in a positive way.
translation.ko: 어찌 됐든 긍정적 영향을 받을 수 있거든요

translation.en: That person represents the whole human race, symbolically.
translation.ko: 여기서 약속 상대는 인류 전체를 상징하는 인물이죠

translation.en: So that's the middle tier, and the highest tier is your relationship with yourself.
translation.ko: 이게 중간 단계고, 최고 단계는 자기 자신과의 관계예요

translation.en: The best way to say it is to get yourself in a relationship with your unconscious,
translation.ko: 최선의 방법은 자기 무의식과 관계를 맺는 거죠

translation.en: because nobody knows what's in their unconscious unless they activate it.
translation.ko: 무의식을 활성화하지 않으면 뭐가 내재됐는지 알 수 없으니까요

translation.en: And one trick about this is writing.
It's really a magical thing.
You enhance your relationship with yourself by writing.
translation.ko: 글을 쓰면 나 자신과 관계가 좋아져요

translation.en: Some people say, "Well, write what?"
translation.ko: 대체 뭘 쓰냐고 묻는 분들도 있죠

translation.en: "I'm not interesting. I'm not a writer." It doesn't matter.
translation.ko: 자긴 재미도 없고 작가도 아니래요 다 상관없어요

translation.en: If you start to write, the writing is like a mirror.
It reflects what's going on in your unconscious,
and things will come out if you write in journal form
translation.ko: 일기 형식의 글을 쓰다 보면 본인도 몰랐던 것들이

translation.en: that you didn't know that you knew.
These are the three levels of the life force.
If you're lost, don't try to figure it out.
translation.ko: 길을 잃었다면 길을 찾으려 애쓰지 마세요

translation.en: Let it go and work on your life force first.
translation.ko: 다 잊고 삶의 원동력부터 찾는 겁니다

translation.en: It's about passion.
Increasing your life force
so you can find out what you're really passionate about.
translation.ko: 자신이 무엇에 열정을 느끼는지 알아낼 수 있어요

translation.en: But step one is to be passionate about connecting to your own life force,
translation.ko: 하지만 열정적으로 삶의 원동력을 찾아내는 것이 첫 번째예요

translation.en: and anybody can do that.
[Jonah] If I just do that pyramid, everything else seems to fall into place?
translation.ko: 그 피라미드대로만 하면 모든 게 제자리를 찾을까요?

translation.en: It will. Everything else will fall in place.
[Jonah] So how do you come up with this stuff?
Well, I once had a supervisor-- I was very young.
translation.ko: 예전에 지도 교수님이 계셨어요 그때 난 아주 어렸죠

translation.en: I didn't even have my own practice yet.
I'm talking to people about what happened 30 years ago in their life
translation.ko: 환자들을 만나면 30년 전에 무슨 일이 있었는지

translation.en: or what was the cause of their problem.
They would walk out the same way they walked in,
feeling like shit and basically hopeless.
So I said to him,
"Is there anything we can do so that they can feel better,
translation.ko: '환자 기분이 나아지도록 뭐라도 느끼게 할 방법 없을까요?'

translation.en: feel something at least, sooner?"
And the guy… [chuckles] The guy says to me,
"Don't you dare," he says.
It was like somebody who fundamentally didn't understand the human condition.
translation.ko: 기본적으로 인간의 상태를 모르는 사람 같았어요

translation.en: I said, "Wait, we have to do something right at the moment."
translation.ko: 난 지금 당장 뭐라도 해야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: It doesn't have to solve all their problems,
but you have to give somebody the feeling that they can change right now.
translation.ko: 달라질 수 있다는 기분을 당장 느끼게 해줘야 한다는 거죠

translation.en: I didn't want people walking out of my office with nothing.
Did you ever worry, with that strategy, you'd give them the wrong piece of action?
translation.ko: 환자들이 엉뚱한 짓을 할까 봐 걱정되진 않으셨어요?

translation.en: No.
In this area, as I always say,
translation.ko: 내가 입버릇처럼 말하지만 이 영역에 관한 한

translation.en: I'm just a regular person, nothing unusual, except for this.
translation.ko: 난 보통 사람과 달라요 이 일에 관해선 그래요

translation.en: I zoom in on you, and I block out everything else.
Since I was a little kid, people have always walked up to me
translation.ko: 어렸을 때부터 사람들은 나한테 고민을 털어놨어요

translation.en: and told me their problems. A little kid.
translation.ko: 어렸을 때부터 사람들은 나한테 고민을 털어놨어요 10살짜리 애한테 다 큰 어른이 찾아왔다니까요

translation.en: I would be ten years old, and a grown man would come up to me.
Most of them I didn't even know. They're just pouring their hearts out.
translation.ko: 대부분 알지도 못하는 사람들인데 감정을 마구 쏟아냈죠

translation.en: Who knows where that comes from.
I was in the Bronx till I was five. Then we moved down to Manhattan.
translation.ko: 5살 때까지 브롱크스에 살다가 맨해튼으로 이사를 했어요

translation.en: [Jonah] Where in Manhattan?
The first place was 78th and Broadway. 215 West 78th Street.
It was regular, middle-class, working people.
My father was a very nice guy.
He was loud, opinionated.
He loved to entertain.
If it was up to him, he would have people over to the house every single night,
translation.ko: 아버지 마음 같아선 매일 밤 손님을 집에 초대하고 싶었겠지만

translation.en: and she hated it.
My mother told me, she said, on a beautiful sunny day in the Bronx,
translation.ko: 어머니는 이런 말씀을 하셨어요 브롱크스의 화창한 날이었죠

translation.en: a trillion kids out playing in the streets,
she told me her favorite thing was to stay indoors and read a book.
translation.ko: 어머니가 제일 좋아하는 일은 실내에서 책을 읽는 거라셨어요

translation.en: Her thing was, "Stay off my case. Stay away from me."
"I want to get lost in this book because life is too painful."
translation.ko: '난 책에 빠지고 싶어 사는 게 너무 고달프거든'

translation.en: "I don't wanna deal with life. I wanna deal with this book."
So you can see these two people, there was big problems.
translation.ko: 이런 두 사람이 만났으니 크게 부딪칠 수밖에요

translation.en: [Jonah] What time period? The '50s?
Yeah. That was, like, uh… '56. It's probably…
Let's see, he-- When did he die?
[Jonah] What was your brother's name who passed away?
[Stutz] His name was Eddie. The one that died, yeah.
They knew immediately.
It was a certain kind of tumor that has a certain kind of rash, I think.
translation.ko: 무슨 발진을 일으키는 특정 종류의 종양이라고 했어요

translation.en: The doctor, he told me years later,
translation.ko: 의사 선생님이 몇 년 후에 말씀하시기를

translation.en: he said he knew the moment he walked into the room what it was.
translation.ko: 동생이 진찰실에 들어오는 순간 바로 알았대요

translation.en: But my parents didn't tell us. It was a mistake.
translation.ko: 근데 부모님은 나한테 숨기셨죠 실수하신 거예요

translation.en: [Jonah] How old are you when he dies? You're nine?
Yeah, I was nine. Yeah.
[Jonah] And he was three?
He was three, yeah.
I would go into the bathroom.
I remember, I'd put one foot up on the toilet bowl,
translation.ko: 변기에 한 발을 올렸던 기억이 나요

translation.en: like I was some kind of a medieval knight or something,
translation.ko: 중세 기사라도 된 것처럼 발을 올리고선

translation.en: and I talked to God, and I said to God,
"If you let him live, I will believe in you."
"If you don't, I won't." Obviously, I had to overcome that.
Any time I'm in New York, I try to go past that building.
translation.ko: 뉴욕에 가면 그 건물은 꼭 지나가려고 해요

translation.en: I like to stand in the spot where we were standing when my father came up to us.
translation.ko: 아버지가 오실 때 우리가 서 있던 그 자리에 서보곤 하죠

translation.en: My mother gets out of the cab
and just walks right into the building and takes the elevator upstairs.
translation.ko: 곧장 건물로 들어가서 올라가는 엘리베이터를 타셨어요

translation.en: She didn't even look at us.
Seriously, I asked my mother, "Can I go back to school?"
And she said, "Yeah, you can do anything you want."
And I did.
And I think that was part of my denial.
Everybody was moving quickly to deny what was happening.
translation.ko: 다들 당시 상황을 부정하려고 부산스레 움직였어요

translation.en: Everybody was avidly not accepting what was going on.
translation.ko: 현실을 받아들이지 않으려고 모두 부단히 애썼죠

translation.en: That was Part X. Part X was in my mind before I understood any of this.
translation.ko: 그게 'X 파트'였어요, X 파트가 부지불식간 마음속에 자리 잡았죠

translation.en: [Jonah] Part X is such a major part of understanding how your tools work,
translation.ko: X 파트는 툴이 어떻게 작용하는지 이해하는 데 아주 중요하죠

translation.en: so I wanted to talk about that.
So, when adversity comes,
it's an opportunity for you to--
At that moment, you're gonna face Part X directly.
translation.ko: 그 순간 X 파트를 똑바로 직면하게 되거든요

translation.en: Part X is the judgmental part of you,
the antisocial part of you.
It's an invisible… force
that wants to keep you from changing or growing.
It wants to block your evolution.
It wants to block your potential.
It wants to fuck up your shit.
So Part X would be the villain
translation.ko: 그러니까 X 파트는 악당 역할인 거네요

translation.en: in the story of being a person.
The tools are what the hero on the journey can use to fight the villain.
translation.ko: 주인공이 악당에 맞서 싸울 때 활용할 수 있는 게 툴이고요

translation.en: Yes. Part X is the voice of impossibility.
translation.ko: 맞아요, X 파트는 불가능을 상징하는 목소리죠

translation.en: Whatever it is you think you need to do, it's gonna tell you that's impossible.
translation.ko: 여러분이 뭘 해야 하건 불가능하다고 말해요

translation.en: "Give up."
It gives you a very specific dossier about who you are, what you're capable of.
translation.ko: 여러분이 누군지, 뭘 할 수 있는지 구체적인 기록을 들이밀어요

translation.en: And it creates this, like, primal fear in human beings.
What does your Part X say to you?
It makes me feel like I'm wasting time.
It tells me I've invented all this stuff,
and the stuff is great, I'm very confident, but it'll never--
translation.ko: 그 자체로 훌륭하고 나 자신도 뿌듯하지만 사회 깊숙이 퍼지진 못할 거라고요

translation.en: It won't spread deeply enough into the culture.
[Jonah] So how can people get rid of Part X?
translation.ko: 어떻게 하면 X 파트를 없앨 수 있나요?

translation.en: You can't.
You can defeat him temporarily, but he's always gonna keep coming back.
translation.ko: 일시적으로 물리칠 순 있어도 그놈은 계속해서 살아나죠

translation.en: That's why you have three aspects of reality that nobody gets to avoid.
translation.ko: 그래서 아무도 피할 수 없는 현실의 3가지 측면이 있는 거예요

translation.en: Pain, uncertainty,
and constant work.
So those are things you're just gonna have to live with, no matter what.
If it did work like that, if you could banish Part X,
translation.ko: 만약 그렇게 X 파트를 완전히 제거한다면

translation.en: then there'd be no further progress.
So if this is a story, the main character needs Part X, needs the villain,
translation.ko: 이게 이야기라고 한다면 주인공에게는 X 파트, 즉 악당이 필요한 거군요

translation.en: because if the main character doesn't have to overcome a villain,
there's no story.
-[Stutz] Right. -There's no growth.
There's no change. There's no bravery. There's no courageousness.
translation.ko: 변화도 용기도 대담함도 다 사라지게 되죠

translation.en: We need the negativity of Part X, or else we don't grow.
translation.ko: X 파트의 부정성이 있어야 성장할 수 있고요

translation.en: [Stutz] Yeah, that's correct.
It doesn't mean you can't, um, work very hard at a goal. It doesn't mean you can't succeed.
translation.ko: 목표를 위해 갖은 고생을 해야만 성공할 수 있다는 뜻은 아니에요

translation.en: But if you wanna be happy-- 'Cause that won't make you happy.
translation.ko: 하지만 행복해지고 싶다면… 그 길은 아니에요

translation.en: What will make you happy is the process.
You have to learn how to love the process of dealing with those three things.
translation.ko: 이 3가지에 대처하는 과정을 사랑하는 법을 배워야 해요

translation.en: That's where the tools come in.
When it appears, you can identify it,
translation.ko: X 파트가 나타날 때 X 파트를 알아볼 수 있을 때

translation.en: and then, you can use a tool on it to nullify it.
translation.ko: 그걸 무력하게 할 툴을 활용하면 돼요 "고통, 불확실성, 노력 툴"

translation.en: If you can teach someone to do that, they can change their whole life.
translation.ko: 그 방법을 가르칠 수 있다면 그 사람은 인생 역전이 가능하죠

translation.en: Because the highest creative expression for a human being
translation.ko: 인간이 할 수 있는 가장 창의적인 표현은

translation.en: is to be able to create something new right in the face of adversity,
translation.ko: 역경 앞에서 새로운 무언가를 창조할 수 있다는 거니까요

translation.en: and the worse the adversity, the greater the opportunity.
translation.ko: 크나큰 역경이 닥칠수록 더 큰 기회가 존재해요

translation.en: Finding out that he'd died was like… It was like discovering a new world.
translation.ko: 동생이 죽은 걸 알았을 때 새로운 세상을 만난 기분이었죠

translation.en: And I said, "Wow, that could happen to me? I'm just a kid."
translation.ko: '나한테 이런 일이 생기다니! 난 아직 어린애인데'

translation.en: That was one of the biggest effects it had on me,
besides the fact that my parents collapsed.
They couldn't quite function as parents emotionally.
They just couldn't do it.
[Jonah] Do you…
Can you blame them?
No, I've never blamed them for that.
Thank God.
Yeah.
It changed my whole life, because everything had a double meaning.
translation.ko: 그 후로 삶 자체가 달라졌죠 모든 게 모호했거든요

translation.en: If I'd go to play softball or something and I had a time to be back for dinner,
translation.ko: 소프트볼 같은 걸 하러 갔다가 저녁때 돌아와야 했다고 쳐요

translation.en: if I was like--
I swear, if I was one minute late, they would just go nuts.
Childhood was over.
Everything was serious. You didn't want to fuck it up.
His death became this giant weight that I had to carry around,
translation.ko: 동생이 죽고 나서는 늘 엄청난 부담감에 짓눌려 살았죠

translation.en: but nobody would admit the fucking weight was there.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 부담감을 알아주는 사람이 없었어요

translation.en: I'll never forget this. A friend of mine, he was badly hurt.
translation.ko: 평생 못 잊을 일이 있었죠 친구 하나가 크게 다치는 바람에

translation.en: I went with my father to visit him in the hospital,
and on the way out, my father turns around, and he says,
translation.ko: 나오는 길에 아버지는 날 돌아보며 말씀하셨죠

translation.en: "That's the only profession."
Meaning, "If you do anything else but become a doctor,
translation.ko: 의사가 되지 않고 다른 일을 하게 되면

translation.en: you're persona non grata over here."
"I love you, but if you don't become a doctor, I'll never respect you."
translation.ko: '널 사랑하지만 의사가 못 되면 널 존중하는 일은 없을 거다'

translation.en: He and my mother were both atheists, so they had nothing to fall back on.
translation.ko: 아버지와 어머니 모두 무신론자라 의지할 곳이 없었어요

translation.en: It was a fight against death, and if I didn't join the fight,
translation.ko: 죽음에 맞서 싸우는데 내가 거기 동참하지 않으면

translation.en: the whole family was gonna fall apart.
Right, so you had a responsibility to satiate their nerves and anxiety.
translation.ko: 그러니까 선생님이 부모님의 불안감을 달래야 했군요

translation.en: You became their therapist.
translation.ko: 두 분의 심리 치료사가 된 거죠

translation.en: That's right. That's exactly right.
So they had nothing in terms of, uh…
[Jonah] Faith?
Yeah, in terms of that would support them in having any faith.
translation.ko: 네, 믿음을 얻는 데 도움이 될 매개체가 없었죠

translation.en: They only had one thing that could lead to faith,
translation.ko: 두 분을 믿음으로 이끌 수 있는 단 하나의 매개체는

translation.en: and that was me.
You see how these things get passed down.
And I… I tried my best.
Total failure, obviously. [chuckles]
I… I… I guess I did do one thing. I became a doctor.
translation.ko: 그래도 하나는 해낸 것 같네요 이렇게 의사가 됐잖아요

translation.en: So, um…
So at least maybe something constructive came out of it.
translation.ko: 거기서 생긴 긍정적인 효과는 좀 있었겠죠

translation.en: Beginning to see patients was like a joke for me.
translation.ko: 환자를 보는 일이 점차 시답잖게 느껴지더군요

translation.en: It was just a change of venue. I had done it so much.
translation.ko: 장소만 바뀌었을 뿐 수도 없이 한 일이니까요

translation.en: And I wasn't bad at it, even when I was 12.
[Stutz] Yeah.
Hey, are we gonna continue these sessions a few times a week where I'm the patient? [chuckles]
translation.ko: 앞으로도 일주일에 몇 번 나 심리 상담 해줄 거예요?

translation.en: It'd be nice if you answered more of these questions.
translation.ko: 질문에 좀 더 대답해 주면 좋겠네요

translation.en: In fact, it would be nice if you answered even one of them.
translation.ko: 하나라도 제대로 대답해 주면 참 좋겠어요

translation.en: We talked about my brother. Can we talk about yours?
translation.ko: 내 동생 얘기를 했으니까 조나의 형 얘기도 해볼까요?

translation.en: It must have stirred up something in you.
[Jonah] Well…
No, I-- No, we're not gonna get into that, um…
[Stutz] Okay.
I think I should take a break. What time-- Oh, shit. Huh.
[Jonah] Yeah.
Yeah.
Dude, that was amazing.
I feel fried.
Yeah, you know, I told you to ask easier questions. It's on you.
translation.ko: 그러게 더 쉬운 질문을 하랬잖아요, 조나 잘못이에요

translation.en: Do you want my notes on your directing or acting?
translation.ko: 연출, 연기에 관해 메모한 거 줄까요?

translation.en: [Jonah laughs] Save it for my session.
[laughs] What is taking so long, dude?
Watch the tracks.
[Stutz] You're in this too?
-[clattering] -[Jonah] Yeah. Oh, shit. [chuckles]
-How are you? -[Jonah] Good to see ya.
I'm gonna use a tool first. Is that okay?
Yeah, absolutely.
Okay. [inhales]
I feel like making this movie is very complicated for a lot of reasons.
translation.ko: 이 영화를 만들기가 여러모로 너무 복잡한 것 같아요

translation.en: You're my therapist, and if I was having trouble with something,
translation.ko: 선생님은 제 심리 치료사시죠 저는 힘든 일이 생기면

translation.en: you'd be who I would talk to about it.
[Jonah] But then when that feeling comes up about this movie,
translation.ko: 근데 이 영화와 관련해서 어떤 감정이 솟구치면

translation.en: I'm hesitant, and I stop it,
because this film is about you,
and I feel like I have to pretend everything is great
translation.ko: 저는 모든 일이 잘 풀리는 척 연기해야 할 것만 같거든요

translation.en: even when it's not.
I've…
been lying to you in our private therapy sessions
translation.ko: 선생님과 비공개 상담을 하면서 줄곧 거짓말을 했어요

translation.en: about how the movie's going.
So I've essentially
been paying you to lie to you,
and that left me feeling more and more alone.
translation.ko: 그러다 보니 점점 더 외로운 기분이 들더라고요

translation.en: I'm trying to land these massive ideas.
translation.ko: 전 이 엄청난 아이디어를 끄집어내려 해요

translation.en: -[Stutz] Right. -And these--
And also tell the story of your life, but I just feel stuck.
translation.ko: 선생님 인생 이야기도 들려주고요 근데 벽에 부딪친 것 같아요

translation.en: And I just keep asking myself, like,
"Was this a fucking terrible idea
for a patient to make a movie about his therapist?" [laughs]
translation.ko: '환자가 자기 심리 치료사에 관한 영화를 만들겠다니'

translation.en: Like I laugh about it, you know?
But what I got to was like, why am I, like, hiding
translation.ko: 근데 궁금해졌어요 제가 왜 자꾸 숨는 건지요

translation.en: behind perfection?
Why am I hiding behind a facade instead of letting you in on it?
translation.ko: 왜 선생님께 마음을 열지 않고 가면 뒤에 숨는지 이상했어요

translation.en: Which felt like the only choice to me.
It is.
How can I make a movie where I'm talking about people
being vulnerable and working on their problems
translation.ko: 나아지려 애쓰는 연약한 사람들의 이야기를 영화로 만들 순 없죠 연약한 나 자신을 숨기면서요

translation.en: and not be vulnerable myself?
translation.ko: 영화로 만들 순 없죠 연약한 나 자신을 숨기면서요

translation.en: It doesn't feel fair.
-And so… -Hmm. …if the choice is to be fair and honest,
translation.ko: 그러니 저 자신이 공평하고 정직한 선택을 하려면

translation.en: then I should acknowledge that, like,
we've been shooting for two years,
and we're wearing the same clothes every day,
translation.ko: 한 번에 진행된 상담처럼 보이게 하려고

translation.en: pretending it's one session,
but it's been years. And we're on a green screen.
translation.ko: 하지만 실상은 몇 년이 지났고 우린 그린 스크린 앞에 있죠

translation.en: We're not in your office.
And I'm literally wearing a wig right now
translation.ko: 그리고 전 지금 가발을 쓰고 있어요

translation.en: to make it look like it was eight months ago when I had this haircut,
and I literally have, like,
a shaved head.
I, like…
I don't know.
It just feels… weird and false.
I want to let the audience in on the filmmaking process, and you,
translation.ko: 영화 제작 과정에 관객과 선생님이 들어오면 좋겠어요

translation.en: so they don't feel like we're just lying to them about shit.
translation.ko: 우리가 허접한 거짓말을 한다고 느끼시지 않게요

translation.en: And I'm lying to you and lying to everyone else that it's going well, and that sucks.
translation.ko: 잘돼 간다고 선생님과 모두에게 거짓말하려니 정말 힘들어요

translation.en: We're probably gonna be watching this scene,
translation.ko: 이제 몇 장면을 같이 볼 텐데요

translation.en: and there's gonna be stuff we shot eight months ago, 14 months ago. Like… [scoffs]
translation.ko: 8개월 전, 14개월 전에 우리가 찍은 영상이 나올 거예요

translation.en: It's just hard to know what is what at this point.
translation.ko: 지금은 도대체 뭐가 뭔지 파악하기가 힘들지만

translation.en: But ultimately, I just came to the truth, which is just letting you in on it.
Does that feel fucked-up?
It feels like the only choice you have, to be honest.
If you want to stay with the truth of me and what we're trying to do,
translation.ko: 나에 관한 진실을 알아내려면 그게 이 일의 목적이라면

translation.en: then you have to let yourself fuck it up.
If you could do it perfectly,
it would contradict everything that we're doing here.
So I'm thrilled that you--
I kind of suspected this anyway, because we're getting--
First of all, we're getting so many days, you know, so I said--
translation.ko: 일단, 촬영을 꽤 오래 했잖아요 내가 저번에 그랬죠?

translation.en: I said, "This is probably the greatest documentary ever made
translation.ko: 사상 최고의 다큐가 되거나 최악의 다큐가 될 거라고요

translation.en: or the worst," and it's probably both.
translation.ko: 사상 최고의 다큐가 되거나 최악의 다큐가 될 거라고요 둘 다일 수도 있고요

translation.en: But listen, it has to eventually get intimate,
translation.ko: 어쨌거나 들어봐요 결국은 깊이 들어가야 해요

translation.en: and once things get intimate, you don't know what the fuck is gonna happen.
translation.ko: 이야기가 내밀해지는 순간 앞일은 예측할 수 없죠

translation.en: If I've trained you properly, you can just see that is not something to avoid.
translation.ko: 내가 제대로 훈련했다면 피할 문제가 아닌 걸 알 거예요

translation.en: The failure would be not rolling with it and not using it to go deeper.
translation.ko: 현실을 부정하고 나아가지 않는 것 깊이 파고들지 않는 것이 실패죠

translation.en: The driving force in this whole thing, to me, is your vulnerability.
translation.ko: 이 모든 일의 원동력은 조나의 연약함에서 나와요

translation.en: [splutters] No question about it.
If we're true to that idea and you're forthcoming with it,
translation.ko: 우리가 그 생각을 믿고 조나가 연약함을 기꺼이 드러내면

translation.en: we really can't go wrong, because--
-But this movie is about you. -[Stutz] No, no, not at all.
translation.ko: 이 영화 주인공은 선생님인데요 그렇지 않아요

translation.en: To me, this is just one more thing.
My life doesn't depend on it.
Your life-- Okay, maybe your life depends on it.
-[both laugh] -[Stutz] Just teasing.
My mind says I want to aggressively and honestly talk about two things.
translation.ko: 내가 적극적으로 솔직하게 이야기하고 싶은 건 2가지예요

translation.en: One is my relationship with you,
and the second thing is the actual power of these tools.
translation.ko: 두 번째는 이 툴이 발휘하는 실질적인 힘이죠

translation.en: So how do I go deeper? Like, how do I--
translation.ko: 어떻게 더 깊이 들어가죠? 무슨 수로…

translation.en: -There's only one way. -Huh?
You.
The thing is, if you wanna move forward…
[splutters] …you can't move forward without being vulnerable.
translation.ko: 연약한 자신을 감추고선 앞으로 나아갈 수 없어요

translation.en: And the reason is everybody needs help in moving forward.
translation.ko: 누구나 앞으로 나아가려면 도움이 필요하기 때문이죠

translation.en: Failure, weakness, vulnerability is like a, um…
translation.ko: 실패, 나약함, 연약한 심신 말하자면 이런 것들은

translation.en: It's like a connector. It connects you to the rest of the world.
Because what you're doing is, you're giving out this signal to the world,
translation.ko: 지금 조나가 하는 일은 세상에 신호를 보내는 거니까요

translation.en: "I need you because I can't do this by myself."
translation.ko: 나 혼자서는 못 하니 당신이 필요하다고요

translation.en: Yeah, that makes a lot of sense.
I think what would be a good idea,
maybe I should show you some of the movie,
and we can kind of figure out how we wanna complete it.
translation.ko: 어떻게 마무리하면 좋을지 같이 생각해 보는 거죠

translation.en: And, like, for us to be in that together if you're down for that?
translation.ko: 영화를 같이 만드는 거예요 선생님만 좋으시다면

translation.en: I am, yeah. I'm really touched.
Um, frankly, I'm relieved also.
So yes, it would be great. It'll be great. It'll be like an experiment.
translation.ko: 그렇게 하면 참 좋겠네요 일종의 실험처럼요

translation.en: Yeah. All right, cool.
Okay, I'm down.
I love you, dude.
Cut. [laughs]
Oh, you guys were filming?
[Jonah] Why do you think I'm making a doc on you?
translation.ko: 제가 왜 이 다큐를 찍는 것 같으세요?

translation.en: I think it's… it's my ideas.
I… I think my ideas had an effect on you,
and I think you wanted to expose other people to the ideas.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들에게도 전파하고 싶은 거 아닐까요?

translation.en: You want to do some Parkinson's drugs?
[Jonah] I kicked the stuff years ago, man.
[Jonah] So we had to build a fake set of your office on the green screen
translation.ko: 그린 스크린 앞에 선생님 상담실 세트를 지어야 했죠

translation.en: to make it seem like we've been here this whole time.
-[Stutz] It's nicer than my real office. -[Jonah laughs] Yeah.
Part X. And then, so when you're watching the movie…
translation.ko: X 파트를 그려서 영화를 보는 관객이…

translation.en: -Like, a view of-- [laughs] -We never had insurance for that.
translation.ko: - 시각적으로… - 그런 보험은 든 적 없는데

translation.en: [Jonah] We've ripped the Band-Aid off.
We've told you where I'm at and the truth of it.
translation.ko: 제가 어떤 상태인지 있는 그대로 말씀드렸어요

translation.en: Where do we go from here?
It feels to me like we have to stay very grounded
translation.ko: 이제 우린 현실에 단단히 발을 붙이고 서서

translation.en: and, at the same time, reach for the stars.
translation.ko: 별을 향해 손을 뻗어야 할 것 같아요

translation.en: I'm not sure how to do both of those at the same time.
translation.ko: 그 2가지를 동시에 어떻게 해야 할진 모르겠지만

translation.en: But anything that's real and that's profound
translation.ko: 진실되고 심오한 것은 그게 무엇이든 간에

translation.en: has to have two, not one, because it's a vibratory thing.
translation.ko: 하나가 아니라 둘이어야 해요 진동을 일으켜야 하니까요

translation.en: Two people can create a field, and a field is invisible,
translation.ko: 두 사람은 에너지장을 형성하죠 에너지장이 눈에 보이지는 않지만

translation.en: but that's the force in the universe that makes things happen.
You can see that in your personal relationships.
You can see it in the global events that are happening now.
translation.ko: 지금 벌어지고 있는 세계적 사건에서도 볼 수 있죠

translation.en: What we're doing here
is giving ourselves over to something that we can't fully understand.
translation.ko: 완전히 이해할 수 없는 대상에 몸을 맡기는 거예요

translation.en: But whatever it is out there, whatever it is up there,
translation.ko: 하지만 저 밖에 저 위에 있는 게 뭐든

translation.en: it wants to have a connection to everybody.
[Stutz] The shame, embarrassment, is actually the glue that holds the universe together.
translation.ko: 수치심과 당혹감이 온 우주를 하나로 이어 붙여주는 거예요

translation.en: It's in that experience that you're forced to connect to somebody else.
translation.ko: 그 경험을 통해서 우리는 강제로 타인과 연결되죠

translation.en: Anyway, things won't be perfect.
In a filming sense or an artistic sense, something might not work out,
translation.ko: 영화 촬영이나 예술적 관점에서 성공을 거두지 못할지라도

translation.en: but in its impossibility, something's gonna happen.
translation.ko: 그 불가능 속에서 어떤 일은 일어나게 돼 있어요

translation.en: This is my real hair, by the way.
What? What's the matter? Wait, what's the matter?
What you have to say is, "I'm gonna do the best I can now."
translation.ko: 지금 최선을 다할 거라고 말하기만 하면 돼요

translation.en: "I'll go to the next thing and do the best I can there."
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 또 최선을 다할 거라고요

translation.en: And it sounds trite and superficial, but believe me, it's not.
translation.ko: 진부하고 피상적인 말 같겠지만 절대 그렇지 않아요

translation.en: Great, so you're saying the worse it is, the better we did?
translation.ko: 상황이 나쁠수록 오히려 더 분발하게 된다는 말씀이시죠?

translation.en: -[Stutz] Yes. -Great.
Isn't that how Hollywood works in general?
-[Jonah laughs] -I always thought. I don't know.
All right, well, then let's just keep going.
[Stutz] If you have the tools, we can turn this around.
translation.ko: 툴이 있다면 상황을 뒤집을 수 있어요

translation.en: So we have to keep going.
Keep going.
It seems stupid. Isn't that, like, simplistic?
It is, but we want to say, "I'm the one who puts the next pearl on the string."
translation.ko: 그래도 다음 진주를 꿸 사람은 나라고 말하고 싶잖아요

translation.en: That's all. Nothing else.
That's called the String of Pearls.
That's probably the most important thing, motivationally, you could teach yourself.
translation.ko: 스스로 터득할 수 있는 가장 중요한 동기 부여법일 거예요

translation.en: You just draw a string of pearls.
There's a line then a circle, line then a circle.
translation.ko: 선과 원을 그리고 다시 선과 원을 그려요

translation.en: Each one of those circles equals one action.
But here's the thing.
Every action has the same value.
This is a matter of identity. "Who am I?"
"I'm not great. I'm not shit. I don't want to look at myself and think…"
translation.ko: '난 대단하지도 못나지도 않았어 나 자신을 바라보기 싫어'

translation.en: I look at myself just in terms of the habits with which I take action.
translation.ko: 나는 나 자신을 바라볼 때 행동과 습관을 들여다봐요

translation.en: If there's a failure or a big success, by the way, either way,
translation.ko: 여러분이 실패를 하든 큰 성공을 거두든

translation.en: you're gonna keep going.
I am the person that puts the next pearl on the string. That's it.
translation.ko: 다음 진주를 꿸 사람은 나라는 사실만 알면 됩니다

translation.en: So essentially getting out of bed in the morning is a string of pearls.
translation.ko: 아침에 침대에서 일어나는 것도 진주를 꿰는 일이죠

translation.en: -Just getting out of bed… -Yes. …and doing what you have to do that day
translation.ko: 침대에서 일어나 그날 할 일을 하는 거예요

translation.en: and not putting, like, a size value on the effort. -[Stutz] That's right. -They're all the same size.
translation.ko: 노력의 가치를 저울질하지 않고요 다 똑같이 중요하니까요

translation.en: The beautiful thing about you, even though you're an asshole,
translation.ko: 조나의 큰 장점은 멍청하지만 멈추지 않는다는 거죠

translation.en: is that you never stop.
You have that. You have a taste for uncertainty.
The first session we had, you said that true confidence is living in uncertainty.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 상담 날, 진정한 자신감은 불확실한 삶을 사는 거라고 하셨죠

translation.en: Yeah, and moving forward.
The winner is not the one who always makes the best decisions or looks the best.
translation.ko: 승자는 늘 최선의 선택을 하거나 제일 멋져 보이는 이가 아니에요

translation.en: The winner is the one who works that cycle.
translation.ko: 삶의 주기를 운용할 줄 아는 이가 승자죠

translation.en: In other words, who's willing to take a risk,
will interact with some degree of faith, and then eats the consequences.
translation.ko: 어느 정도 믿음에 의지하면서 주어진 결과를 감당하는 사람이죠

translation.en: If the consequences are bad, then you gotta work the cycle again.
translation.ko: 결과가 좋지 않으면 그 주기를 다시 거쳐야 해요

translation.en: That's as good as it gets.
Now, here's the thing.
In every one of these little circles, there's a little darker circle,
translation.ko: 작은 원마다 색이 더 짙은 점이 들어 있어요

translation.en: much smaller, and the darker circle is a turd.
translation.ko: 훨씬 더 작고 색이 더 짙은 이 점은 똥이죠

translation.en: It's kind of funny in a way, but what it says is every effort you make…
translation.ko: 어떻게 보면 웃기지만 여러분이 하는 모든 노력을 뜻해요

translation.en: Let's say now. We're trying to do this film.
However this comes out, it's not gonna come out perfectly. So there's gonna be a turd in it.
translation.ko: 결과물은 절대 완벽할 리 없어요 똥이 들었을 테죠

translation.en: It's like I don't know if this is good, so I don't have to worry about that.
translation.ko: 이게 좋은지는 나도 몰라요 그러니 걱정할 필요가 없어요

translation.en: I have to worry about forward motion, putting the next pearl on the string.
translation.ko: 전진에만 신경 써야 해요 다음 진주를 꿰는 일요

translation.en: I'll tell you, my life philosophy has turned into the opposite of that.
translation.ko: 제 인생철학은 정확히 그 반대로 바뀌었어요

translation.en: So instead of a turd inside of a pearl,
translation.ko: 진주 안에 똥이 들어 있는 게 아니라

translation.en: there's a pearl around every turd.
Because when something bad happens, I go, like, "There's a lot to be learned
translation.ko: 나쁜 일이 생기면 배울 게 많겠다고 생각하거든요

translation.en: and a lot of good around this event."
translation.ko: 이 일로 얻는 게 많을 거라고요

translation.en: That's fantastic. I'm gonna steal that one.
Well, I'll sue you.
[laughs] I love you. I don't care.
Good. I'll see you in court.
If this whole movie ends in, like, a ten-year, bitter lawsuit between the two of us…
translation.ko: 10년 뒤에 피 터지는 법정 공방을 벌이면서 영화가 끝나면 참…

translation.en: It's very intimate. It's cool.
[Jonah] So meeting you and starting our process
was out of desperation to get happier.
translation.ko: 더 행복해지고 싶다는 간절한 마음 때문이었어요

translation.en: It's hard to say. It's just I had no… healthy self-esteem.
translation.ko: 설명하기 어렵지만 저는 건전한 자부심이 없었어요

translation.en: Right.
Having grown up overweight
was something, um, that sounds like not a big deal
translation.ko: 얼핏 대수롭지 않은 일처럼 들릴 수도 있어요

translation.en: or like, "Poor you," or whatever.
But for me personally,
it intensely fucked me up.
You explained to me the idea of a Shadow.
It's the version of yourself that you want to hide from the world the most.
translation.ko: 세상에서 제일 숨기고 싶은 나 자신의 모습을 의미하죠

translation.en: And this is what I pictured that day. Me at 14.
translation.ko: 이게 그날 제가 상상했던 14살의 제 모습이에요

translation.en: When I met you, I was 33, maybe.
I had an incredible amount of success,
was in really great shape, physically.
All things that should have rendered this idea of myself nonexistent…
translation.ko: 당시는 이런 모습의 내가 머릿속에 존재하지 않아야 맞는 상황인데

translation.en: …but what you explained to me was that this is how I saw myself,
translation.ko: 선생님은 제가 저 자신을 이렇게 보고 있다고 말씀하셨죠

translation.en: and I was denying myself
because I felt so much shame about… -[Stutz] Right. -…that this was me.
translation.ko: 이 녀석이 저라는 게 너무 부끄러워서 말이에요

translation.en: I thought, if I got successful, they wouldn't see that.
translation.ko: 제가 성공하면 치부가 숨겨질 줄 알았는데

translation.en: And then I did, and then all people did was just say more of that,
translation.ko: 성공하고 나니, 모든 사람이 제 치부를 더 많이 이야기하더군요

translation.en: and it hurt.
And then I still felt like this person,
translation.ko: 아직도 제가 이 녀석인 것 같은 기분이 들었어요

translation.en: and that… still resides in me in a way that comes up.
translation.ko: 이 녀석은 지금도 제 안에 있다가 불쑥불쑥 튀어나오죠

translation.en: So inherently, at my core, I'm still this unlovable person,
translation.ko: 저란 사람은 아직도 이렇게 비호감인 거예요

translation.en: but the work is, like, inching towards
not only accepting but, like, bringing this--
-That it's great to be this person. -Yes.
But that's still very hard.
Yeah, it'll be hard for the rest of your life.
[Stutz] Everybody has a Shadow. Everybody's Shadow is a bit different,
translation.ko: 누구나 그림자가 있어요 저마다 조금씩 다르긴 해도요

translation.en: but on the other hand, everybody's Shadow is the same,
translation.ko: 근데 다른 한편으로는 모든 그림자가 똑같죠

translation.en: because it's the part of themselves they're ashamed of.
translation.ko: 그림자는 본인 스스로 부끄럽게 느끼는 부분이니까요

translation.en: The first thing you want to do is find your Shadow.
You have to be able to see this thing to focus on it
translation.ko: 그림자를 집중적으로 연구할 수 있어야 합니다

translation.en: and to know how to work with it.
[splutters] You need a visual.
So close your eyes.
Now visualize a time in your life
translation.ko: 이제 인생의 어느 시점을 한번 떠올려 보세요

translation.en: when you felt inferior, embarrassed, rejected, despondent,
translation.ko: 열등감이 들고 당황스러운 순간 거절당하고 낙담한 때를요

translation.en: that you're ashamed of it.
It's the part of you that you wish you were not,
translation.ko: 내가 아니었으면 하고 바라게 되는 모습이지만

translation.en: but you are, and not only that, you can't get rid of it.
translation.ko: 그 역시 엄연히 나예요 게다가 없앨 수도 없죠

translation.en: To me, it's a 14-year-old boy who's very overweight and has acne
translation.ko: 제 그림자는 14살 남자아이예요 엄청 뚱뚱하고 여드름도 나고

translation.en: and feels very undesirable to the world.
translation.ko: 모두가 날 비호감으로 보는 것만 같은 심정이죠

translation.en: Okay. The question is, "What do you do with that image in the present?"
translation.ko: 중요한 건, 지금 그 이미지를 어떻게 처리하느냐예요

translation.en: That's something from the past, right?
Talk to your Shadow and ask him how does he feel about you.
translation.ko: 그림자에게 물어봐요 지금은 조나를 어떻게 생각하는지

translation.en: How you've dealt with him, how you've treated him.
And see what he answers.
translation.ko: 그 답을 들어봐요 "당신의 그림자에 귀 기울여라"

translation.en: He says, "You've denied my existence,
and you felt shame at my mere existence."
Ask him how he feels about that.
Unbelievably hurt, angry, and upset.
Now, listen very carefully.
The Shadow needs attention,
but he needs the attention not from the world.
He doesn't need an Academy Award.
The only being whose attention matters to your Shadow is you.
translation.ko: 의미 있는 관심을 줄 수 있는 존재는 조나뿐이에요

translation.en: I want you to ask your Shadow, what can you do
to make up for the fact that you didn't pay attention to him for such a long time?
translation.ko: 오랫동안 관심을 주지 않은 걸 어떻게 하면 보상할 수 있을지

translation.en: He says to include him in my life
translation.ko: 제 인생에 자기도 받아들여 달라고 하네요

translation.en: and share my life with him and celebrate him.
translation.ko: 자기와 삶을 공유하고 자기를 세상에 알려 달래요

translation.en: And be proud of me.
Meaning in, like, a social setting or a work setting or a romantic setting,
translation.ko: 사회적 환경이나 일하는 곳, 낭만적인 상황에서는

translation.en: where you're not acknowledging this person,
and it's not only okay that they exist, but they are a beautiful part of you.
translation.ko: 존재 자체를 인정하는 걸 넘어 멋진 존재인 걸 알아 달래요

translation.en: [Stutz] All right. Open your eyes.
This is a tool that will hopefully make your relationship with your Shadow better.
translation.ko: 이 툴이 조나와 그림자의 관계를 개선하게 해 줄 거예요

translation.en: This is good for shyness.
It's good if you have to make a public presentation.
It's even good if you have to confront your spouse. It doesn't really matter.
translation.ko: 배우자에게 맞서야 할 때 써도 좋은 툴이에요

translation.en: Or you're going on a date.
Or anything that's, like, high-stakes or high-pressure,
translation.ko: 아주 중요하고 부담되는 일이 있을 때나

translation.en: where you feel you have to be your, quote-unquote, unflawed, best self.
translation.ko: '완벽한 나'로 무장해야 한다는 기분이 들 때도 좋고요

translation.en: Yeah. Our goal is not to give a good performance.
translation.ko: 우리 목표는 좋은 성과를 내는 게 아니라

translation.en: Our goal is to use this tool and then tolerate whatever happens.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 벌어지든 간에 이 툴을 활용해 견디는 거예요

translation.en: Yeah, because if I'm content with my true self,
translation.ko: 그렇죠, 진실된 나 자신에게 스스로 만족한다면

translation.en: then other people's opinions just affect me way, way less.
translation.ko: 다른 사람 의견에 영향을 훨씬 덜 받을 테니까요

translation.en: So you understand what we're talking about, it's not how this looks or if it looks good or bad.
translation.ko: 겉모습이 문제가 아니에요 어떻게 보이는지는 중요치 않죠

translation.en: It's the process of constantly relating to it that matters.
translation.ko: 끊임없이 관계를 맺는 과정이 중요한 거예요

translation.en: If you don't pay him respect, or attention is the best word for it,
he'll make you do things that are actually destructive.
So it's both a tool that will make you feel better in the moment,
translation.ko: 이 툴을 활용하면 즉각적으로 기분이 나아지고

translation.en: and it's also a philosophy about, "Where am I going as a human being?"
translation.ko: 한 인간으로서의 지향점을 철학적으로 탐구하게 돼요

translation.en: And the idea of being in sync with the Shadow,
it's a sense of wholeness.
Wholeness means I don't need anything else.
"I'm whole the way I am." And that's very freeing.
translation.ko: 지금 이대로 완전하다는 생각은 큰 해방감을 주죠

translation.en: Whoops. Sorry.
Please don't kick my Shadow.
Very good. I'm sorry.
-Did he hurt you? -[Stutz laughs]
Did the weird man hurt you?
See, I love him now. I have to take care of him.
-You can come home with me. -[laughs]
I met you five years ago, and I had no confidence as a human being.
translation.ko: 5년 전에 선생님을 만났을 땐 인간으로서 자신감이 없었어요

translation.en: -I just didn't invest in myself. -Right.
And, like, understand how to like myself.
I just worked to achieve this thing,
translation.ko: 이걸 손에 넣으려고 그저 열심히 노력했어요

translation.en: which is your idea of the Snapshot.
[Stutz] That's correct.
So this is also called the Realm of Illusion.
Again, it's a classic Part X thing.
It means that you are looking for a perfect experience.
translation.ko: 여러분이 완벽한 경험을 추구한다는 것을 의미하죠

translation.en: So it could be the perfect wife, the perfect amount of money in the bank,
translation.ko: 추구하는 대상이 완벽한 아내든 완벽한 액수의 돈이든 완벽한 영화든

translation.en: the perfect movie.
It doesn't matter. Whatever it is, it doesn't exist.
It's just an image in your own mind. Think about this.
translation.ko: 머릿속의 이미지에 불과하죠 잘 생각해 봐요

translation.en: What is the nature of a snapshot?
It has no movement, right? It's still.
And it has no depth.
But in this case, you've taken this Snapshot,
translation.ko: 하지만 이 경우에는 자신이 찍은 스냅숏 때문에

translation.en: and you've crippled yourself with it.
You fantasize.
People tell themselves, if they can enter that perfect world,
translation.ko: 환상에 빠져서는 이렇게 되뇌죠 저 완벽한 세계에 들어가면 마법이 일어날 거라고요

translation.en: then magic will happen.
translation.ko: 저 완벽한 세계에 들어가면 마법이 일어날 거라고요

translation.en: But you can't forget
there are three aspects of reality.
The pain will never go away. Uncertainty will never go away.
And there's no getting away from the need for constant work.
translation.ko: 그리고 살아 있는 한 끝없이 노력해야 해요

translation.en: Everybody has to live like that, no matter what.
translation.ko: 누구나 예외 없이 그렇게 살아야 하죠

translation.en: Before I met you, I'm this, like, wildly insecure kid,
translation.ko: 선생님을 만나기 전에 저란 녀석은… 극도로 불안정했어요

translation.en: and then, uh, I think
translation.ko: 좀 더 지나서는 제가 성공하고 상을 받으면

translation.en: success and awards will absolve me of the pain of life.
translation.ko: 좀 더 지나서는 제가 성공하고 상을 받으면 삶의 고통에서 벗어날 수 있을 줄 알았죠

translation.en: So I work so hard to get to that Snapshot,
and because of my privilege and luck,
I got to go into that Snapshot relatively early,
translation.ko: 비교적 빨리 스냅숏 세계에 입성하게 됐죠

translation.en: and when it didn't cure any of that stuff,
translation.ko: 그런데도 기존의 문제가 전혀 해결되지 않자

translation.en: it made me beyond depressed.
translation.ko: 저는 이루 말할 수 없는 우울감에 빠졌어요

translation.en: Yes.
At the same time, the media kept kind of like being really brutal
translation.ko: 동시에 언론에선 계속 몸무게 문제로 사정없이 저를 공격해 댔어요

translation.en: about my weight.
translation.ko: 언론에선 계속 몸무게 문제로 사정없이 저를 공격해 댔어요

translation.en: It was just kind of free game for anyone to sort of… hit my sore spot.
translation.ko: 모든 언론이 마음대로 절 표적으로 삼아 아픈 곳을 후벼팠죠

translation.en: It made me so defensive.
Like almost anticipating someone saying something mean.
translation.ko: 누가 못된 말을 할 것 같은 생각만 들어도

translation.en: And I'd be so angry.
It kept me from feeling any sense of, like,
translation.ko: 그러다 보니 이겨 낼 마음이 좀처럼 생겨나질 않더라고요

translation.en: able to grow past negative feelings about myself
translation.ko: 나에 대한 부정적 감정을 극복할 자신이 없어지고

translation.en: and made me more ashamed of my Shadow.
And it wasn't until more recently, my thirties, when I met you,
that's when I learned to take steps towards locking that out
translation.ko: 부정적 감정을 차단하는 방법을 배우게 됐고

translation.en: or forming my own opinion of self.
Does that make sense?
-You know? -[chews]
Here, wait, let's-- Are you chewing on something?
Yeah.
We're making a movie, dude!
You should've told me that before you invited me.
He's fucking eating chocolate! You have any calls you wanna take?
translation.ko: 초콜릿을 씹어 먹다니! 전화 올 데는 없으세요?

translation.en: [laughs] I do, but let's see how this goes.
Sorry, I'm checking my notes real quick.
[Stutz] That's just--
I just wrote down about I banged your mother. Just cross it out.
translation.ko: 조나 엄마랑 잤다고 적었는데 그건 지워버려요

translation.en: The irony of the banging your mom joke is my mom is coming here tomorrow,
translation.ko: 농담 타이밍 한번 끝내주네요 내일 엄마를 모셔 올 거거든요

translation.en: and we literally are gonna do a session with you, me, and my mom.
-Get the fuck out. -[Jonah] I'm not even kidding.
Well, don't tell her I…
-No, I'm gonna tell her. -[Stutz laughs]
-[Jonah] Okay. -Hi.
-Hi, guys. -I like that color on you.
-Thank you. -You look nice.
Thank you.
This is my mom, Sharon.
-Sharon, hi. I'm Phil. -Nice to meet you.
Great to meet you.
Great to meet you.
Yeah, so I don't know.
I was thinking about my first experience with therapy.
translation.ko: 처음 상담 치료를 받았던 때를 생각해 봤어요

translation.en: We were at a nutritionist's office,
and we were arguing so much that the nutritionist said,
-"You guys should go see a therapist." -100% correct.
The doctor was like, "Jonah should lose weight,"
and so you were like, as a mom, "Shit, I should listen to the doctor
translation.ko: 엄마는 부모로서 이랬겠죠 '젠장, 의사 말대로 해야겠네'

translation.en: and take him to a nutritionist."
To be perfectly honest, I would say I didn't need him to tell me.
translation.ko: 정말 솔직히 말하자면 의사의 진단은 필요 없었어

translation.en: I maybe might have thought that you should lose some weight.
translation.ko: 네가 살을 빼야 한다는 걸 어렴풋이 알았거든

translation.en: And I kinda don't want to go to the past, but you have to go to the past sometimes,
translation.ko: 지난 이야기를 하긴 싫지만 가끔 필요할 때도 있지

translation.en: because my mother specifically was extremely small, and so was my sister,
translation.ko: 어머니는 체격이 왜소하셨고 제 자매도 마찬가지여서

translation.en: and I was always talked to about, "You're big like your dad."
translation.ko: 전 늘 이런 말을 들었어요 '아빠 닮아서 뚱뚱하구나'

translation.en: "You're the bigger one. You need to lose weight."
And I think it gave me so much anxiety
when either I didn't look that way or my kids didn't look that way
translation.ko: 저나 제 아이들이 날씬해 보이지 않으면요

translation.en: that, I feel like, instead of thinking about what I was doing,
translation.ko: 제가 뭘 하는 건지 제대로 생각해 보지도 않고

translation.en: I was just doing what I thought was right. -[Stutz] Mm-hmm. -If that makes sense.
Yeah, I'm not like trying attack you or anything like that.
So you see me being an overweight kid,
and I feel that, and the doctor feels that,
and society has its own constructs why that's defective or wrong.
translation.ko: 비만을 결함 또는 문제로 보는 사회적 통념도 있고요

translation.en: So, I'm like, "I am not good."
translation.ko: 그러니 이런 기분을 느낀 거죠 '난 참 별로야'

translation.en: "I am bad."
"I don't look correct for the world."
And you have to be the person
translation.ko: 그러면 엄마는 이런 사람이 될 수밖에 없어요

translation.en: that is attempting to correct that, for whatever those reasons are.
translation.ko: 이유가 무엇이든 간에 그 상황을 바로잡으려 하는 사람요

translation.en: Right.
It immediately put you in the position of being adversarial.
translation.ko: 근데 그 즉시 저는 엄마를 적대적으로 보게 됐죠

translation.en: Of like, "This is the person that doesn't… accept me."
translation.ko: 절 받아들이지 않는 사람으로 인식한 거예요

translation.en: It's the idea that the woman figure will not accept how you look.
translation.ko: 여성이 내 외모를 받아들일 리 없다고 생각하게 된 거죠

translation.en: I do not place blame on you,
because I also now understand, and have already understood for a while,
translation.ko: 이제 전 이해하니까요 사실 이해한 지 한참 됐죠

translation.en: how much you felt like me in your family. [Stutz] Hmm.
translation.ko: 엄마가 엄마 가족들 사이에서 저와 같은 심정이었다는 걸요

translation.en: [Jonah] I just want to let you know how it affected my life.
translation.ko: 다만 제 인생에 미친 영향을 알아주셨으면 해요

translation.en: Because for me, sometimes it's easier to have conversations like this
translation.ko: 가끔은 이게 더 편하더라고요 왜인지는 몰라도 이런 대화는 이런 식으로 하는 게 편해요

translation.en: in this form for whatever reason than it--
translation.ko: 왜인지는 몰라도 이런 대화는 이런 식으로 하는 게 편해요

translation.en: Thank you, Jonah. I appreciate that.
I want to say thank you, because you've never articulated it
translation.ko: 난 너한테 고마워 분명히 말해준 건 처음이잖아

translation.en: as "the female figure in your life not accepting the way that you look,"
translation.ko: 여성에게 네 외모가 받아들여지지 않을 거란 생각을 했다고 말이야

translation.en: and I never thought of it that way.
I tried to just fix it
without even thinking about how me telling you to do this would affect you.
translation.ko: 내가 타이르는 방식이 너한테 어떤 영향을 줄진 생각도 못 했어

translation.en: Just so we get this straight, it's not this or that.
translation.ko: 자, 정리해 봅시다 이건 흑백 문제가 아니에요

translation.en: That's not the point.
No matter how clear the past is for you,
for you, the question is, what's going on now between the two of you,
translation.ko: 관건은 지금 두 사람 사이에 무슨 일이 벌어지고 있고

translation.en: and what do you need?
-Did you ever think about that? -I do, sometimes.
translation.ko: - 생각해 본 적 있어요? - 네, 가끔은요

translation.en: And can you tell us what you think?
-You can speak honestly. -[Sharon] I know. I'm thinking.
translation.ko: - 솔직히 말해도 돼요 - 알아, 생각 중이야

translation.en: I would like a little bit more consistency.
translation.ko: 좀 더 일관성 있는 관계가 되면 좋겠어요

translation.en: Sometimes, I feel like Jonah comes to me,
but I am his mother, when he needs to talk to me.
And when he's, like, super happy, it's like I'm in no-man's-land somewhere.
translation.ko: 조나가 정말 행복할 때는 제가 설 자리가 없는 것 같아요

translation.en: I'm not in his mind or relevant. I don't know.
I just like time with Jonah,
because I think we have a real relationship.
We've been through a lot, and I think our relationship is deep,
translation.ko: 함께 많은 일을 겪었고 유대 관계도 깊죠

translation.en: but sometimes I get anxious.
When I'm like-- If I think that he's not gonna either like what I say or…
translation.ko: 내가 무슨 말을 하면 조나가 싫어하지 않을까 하는…

translation.en: I don't know. It's hard to articulate, but…
Articulate that.
I'm trying.
I find myself holding back from being exactly myself
translation.ko: 진짜 제 모습을 숨기려 드는 것 같아요

translation.en: because I don't want him to think a certain way about me.
[Stutz] Did you know that?
I didn't know that.
But sometimes I react poorly
translation.ko: 하지만 저도 가끔 형편없이 반응하곤 해요

translation.en: when I feel you're not listening to others and eating up the air or space.
translation.ko: 엄마가 남의 말을 안 듣고 관심을 독차지하려는 것 같을 때요

translation.en: Right, I know.
But I think it's cool for me to hear, like, notes on what I could do better
translation.ko: 그래도 엄마 속마음을 듣고 나니 후련하네요 제가 어떡하면 더 좋을지

translation.en: or what she needs to make the relationship better
in this context, honestly, 'cause I won't feel as defensive.
translation.ko: 솔직히 지금은 제가 방어적으로 굴 리도 없고

translation.en: -You mean if there's a third party here? -[Jonah] Yeah.
Speaking of, Phil mentioned something yesterday.
translation.ko: 말이 나와서 말인데 필이 어제 뭐랬냐면요

translation.en: He said you guys were together intimately.
-Wanna address that? -[Sharon] He's joking.
No, he said that. We have it on film.
He wouldn't forget, trust me. [laughs]
There you go.
-There you go. -Dude, fuck.
I think this could be a good time to wrap now.
translation.ko: 이제 마무리할 때가 된 것 같네요

translation.en: -I think it's time. -All right.
Um, well, one thing before we do, actually. Not a joke.
Like, did you ever have-- Not like this, literally,
translation.ko: 선생님은 혹시… 꼭 이런 대화는 아니더라도

translation.en: but did you ever have this kind of emotionally open conversation with your mom ever?
translation.ko: 어머니와 이렇게 마음을 터놓고 대화하신 적 있어요?

translation.en: No, not even close.
If she was around now, would you?
Now? Yeah.
Yeah.
You gotta understand, my mother was from a different planet.
translation.ko: 우리 어머니는 다른 행성에서 오신 분 같았죠

translation.en: Her father, he was, uh, a psychopath.
So he would come in and beat the shit out of his wife
and also the youngest one but never touched my mother,
translation.ko: 막내도요 우리 어머니만 건들지 않았는데 그게 제일 괴로웠대요

translation.en: and that was the worst torture for her of all.
translation.ko: 우리 어머니만 건들지 않았는데 그게 제일 괴로웠대요

translation.en: So I think, by the time she was eight, nine years old,
she wouldn't say a word to him.
1932, the height of the Depression, he just ups and leaves.
He doesn't say anything, doesn't tell them he's leaving.
In the middle of the night, he books. He's gone.
Forty years later, he tried to, um, contact my mother,
translation.ko: 40년 후에 외할아버지는 우리 어머니에게 연락하려 했지만

translation.en: but my mother is hard-core. Forget it. I don't think she answered the letter.
translation.ko: 어머니는 단호한 분이라 무시했죠 편지에 답장도 안 했을걸요

translation.en: She had this thing with men, for obvious reasons.
Every night at dinner, she'd give a tirade about men.
translation.ko: 저녁 식사 때마다 남자들을 신랄하게 비난했어요

translation.en: "Men are this, men are that." I couldn't really disagree with her.
translation.ko: '남자들은 이래' 하면서요 딱히 반대할 수가 없었어요

translation.en: My poor father had to be the cheerleader for this.
-[Jonah] What would he do? -He'd say, "Yeah, she's right."
-[Jonah laughs] -"Men are terrible."
It didn't occur to me until I was about 13, 14. "Shit, I'm a man. Hmm."
But she couldn't get over that, even 50 years later.
-Couldn't get over it. -[Jonah] She's stuck in the Maze.
She's stuck in the Maze for 40 years, 50 years, yeah.
The Maze always involves other people.
It's the product of Part X,
because Part X wants fairness.
A classic example
is when somebody only wants to think and talk about another person.
translation.ko: 다른 사람만 신경 쓰고 다른 사람 얘기만 하려는 사람이죠

translation.en: What you're telling yourself is,
"I'll move past this once they make up for whatever it is,
translation.ko: '그들이 잘못을 만회하면 그때 없던 일로 할 거야'

translation.en: being angry at me, cheating." It doesn't matter what.
translation.ko: 자기한테 화를 냈든 사기를 쳤든 그건 상관없어요

translation.en: You feel they've mistreated you, and your quest for fairness puts your life on hold.
translation.ko: 누가 날 함부로 대한 것 같으면 공정성을 찾느라 삶을 방치하는데

translation.en: Time is fleeting, and we don't have time for that bullshit.
translation.ko: 시간은 덧없이 흐르죠 우린 허비할 시간이 없어요

translation.en: [Jonah] I feel like I spent my whole fucking life in the Maze.
translation.ko: 저는 평생 미로에 갇혀 산 것 같아요

translation.en: Being stuck on not being paid back for something I was viewing as unfair
translation.ko: 제대로 보상받지 못해서 억울하다는 생각에 사로잡혀 지낸 거예요

translation.en: wasted hours, days, months, years of my life that I can't get back.
translation.ko: 인생을 몇 년이나 허비했고 그 시간은 이제 되돌릴 수 없죠

translation.en: So how could she have gotten out of the Maze?
[Stutz] Here's the thing. The average person wants to get paid back.
translation.ko: 대체로 사람은 보상받고 싶은 심리가 있어요

translation.en: They want everything to be fair. They want everything to be balanced.
translation.ko: 매사에 공정하길 바라고 안정적인 상태를 원하죠

translation.en: But you're not gonna get it from them.
The way you feel you're getting paid,
the way you feel things are being rebalanced,
is to get your satisfaction from the exercise itself.
translation.ko: 훈련 과정 그 자체에서 만족감을 얻으면 돼요

translation.en: That's called Active Love.
So close your eyes
and imagine you're surrounded by a universe completely made out of love.
translation.ko: 사랑으로만 이뤄진 우주에 둘러싸여 있다고 상상해 봐요

translation.en: I know it sounds nuts, but just shut the fuck up. Do what I tell you.
translation.ko: 미친 소리 같겠지만 토 달지 말고 시키는 대로 해요

translation.en: -[laughs] -Don't prejudge it and see what happens.
Let me try to define it.
It's just… It's a world that's almost dense with loving energy.
translation.ko: 그 세상에는 사랑의 힘이 가득 채워져 있는 거예요

translation.en: Feel yourself taking in all the love in the universe,
translation.ko: 우주의 모든 사랑을 흡수하는 기분을 느껴봐요

translation.en: and gently, but firmly, place all of it in your heart.
translation.ko: 온 우주의 사랑이 서서히 가슴 속을 가득 메우는 거죠

translation.en: Right at that moment, you're the principal leader of love
translation.ko: 바로 그 순간 조나는 막강한 사랑의 리더가 돼요

translation.en: in the whole universe.
What you do is you want to see the person you're angry at,
translation.ko: 조나가 할 일은 화를 돋우는 상대를 보는 거죠

translation.en: that you hate, that you despise,
and you send all this love you've concentrated
translation.ko: 그리고 모든 사랑을 한곳으로 모아 쏘아 보내요

translation.en: towards the other person.
You hold nothing back. You give everything.
You feel, not just see,
you feel your love enter the other person's body.
translation.ko: 조나의 사랑이 다른 사람의 몸에 들어가는 걸 느끼는 일이

translation.en: It's very important.
For a minute, you become one.
At that point, you feel like, "If I can become one with this bastard,
translation.ko: 그때 이런 생각이 들 거예요 '이 개자식과 하나 될 수 있다면'

translation.en: I can become one with anybody."
And that's the sense of prowess, almost of mastery.
translation.ko: 그렇게 전문가처럼 숙달된 기술이 생기는 거죠

translation.en: People say, "Well, you're asking me to love somebody I hate."
translation.ko: 미운 사람을 사랑하라는 말 아니냐고들 하는데

translation.en: It's not a way to forgive somebody. It's not for the other person.
translation.ko: 이건 남을 용서하는 행위도 타인을 위한 일도 아니에요

translation.en: It's to make you feel whole and then free you from the Maze.
translation.ko: 스스로 완전한 기분을 느끼고 미로에서 벗어나

translation.en: Then you can move forward.
So do you wanna be right, or do you wanna create something?
That's what it always comes down to.
Life is moving forward.
If you want to waste your time playing games over here, you can,
but you can't get those days, hours back.
translation.ko: 지나간 날들은 그 시간은 되돌릴 수 없죠

translation.en: When she got older, she became a community organizer,
translation.ko: 어머니는 노년에 지역 사회 조직가가 되셨고

translation.en: and she was awesome.
If you asked her, "What was your job?" she would say, "Organizing rent strikes."
translation.ko: 직업이 뭐냐고 물으면 집세 지불 거부 운동을 준비하는 일을 한다고 하셨죠

translation.en: "That's what I do for a living." She wasn't scared of anybody.
translation.ko: 집세 지불 거부 운동을 준비하는 일을 한다고 하셨죠 어머니는 무서운 사람이 없었어요

translation.en: In fact, the mayor of New York sees my mother and says, "Wait a minute."
translation.ko: 뉴욕 시장이 어머니를 보면 주춤하며 이랬다니까요

translation.en: "I will not proceed with this negotiation until Rosalie Stutz leaves."
translation.ko: 로절리 스터츠가 갈 때까지 협상을 진행하지 않겠다고요

translation.en: [laughs] And they had to make her leave. He was scared to death of her.
translation.ko: 그래서 어머니를 들여보내야 했죠 시장이 벌벌 떨었거든요

translation.en: [Jonah] She turned her tragedy with men into a superpower
translation.ko: 남자 때문에 겪은 비극 덕에 남자를 겁내지 않았기에

translation.en: of not being scared of them and getting great good done.
translation.ko: 남자 때문에 겪은 비극 덕에 남자를 겁내지 않았기에 훌륭한 일을 해내셨군요

translation.en: Yeah, she did.
[Jonah] How do you think that affects you,
having your mom hate men and you being a man?
I can feel everybody waiting for the answer,
but I don't know if I know exactly the answer.
I know one thing for sure. [chuckles]
It made me insecure around women. I mean, that's a no-brainer.
It was like there was no pathway inside me
translation.ko: 어떤 대응 방법 자체가 머릿속에 없었어요

translation.en: that could step to a woman and feel safe.
I guess that's the best way to say it.
[Jonah] Because you think your mom's reaction to you was to, like, cut you down,
translation.ko: 어머니가 늘 무시하는 반응을 보이셨기 때문에

translation.en: and so you couldn't see a way with women where you could feel safe?
translation.ko: 여자와 편안하게 함께하는 방법을 몰랐다는 거죠?

translation.en: Yeah. It wasn't even on my list of expectations.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 그런 건 애초에 기대조차 하지 않았어요

translation.en: The way she would make me feel is, "You have no right to even be doing this."
translation.ko: 어머니는 아예 나를 자격 미달 취급하셨죠

translation.en: I overcame it a little bit, but not--
I didn't overcome it emotionally so much as I did just behaviorally.
translation.ko: 행동하는 것만큼 정서적으로는 극복 못 했어요

translation.en: Do you think it made it hard to trust women, like, overall?
translation.ko: 그래서 결국 여자를 믿기가 힘들어졌다고 생각하세요?

translation.en: Not-- Well, is it… Now?
It's not that much of an issue now.
I'll tell you one thing, I'd be a much better partner now than I was years ago.
translation.ko: 몇 년 전보다는 나은 파트너가 될 수 있을 것 같아요

translation.en: Although that's a very low bar.
[chuckling] That's a very low bar.
[Jonah] Where do you stand personally on romantic relationships?
You mean am I in one, you mean?
[Jonah] Yeah, are you in one?
No, I'm not in one. Um…
[Jonah] Did you ever override that wall that was built by your mom
translation.ko: 어머니가 쌓아 올린 벽을 직접 무너뜨리고

translation.en: and get close in the way you were scared to with a woman?
translation.ko: 두려움을 뛰어넘어 여자에게 다가간 적 있나요?

translation.en: I would say,
yeah, once.
But I… for various reasons, I can't get into the specifics of it.
translation.ko: 근데 여러 가지 사정이 있어서 자세히 얘기할 순 없어요

translation.en: [Jonah] Was this a long time ago? Was this, like, in recent years?
It's been on and off for 40 years.
[chuckles] As crazy as that might sound.
[Jonah] And what prevents it from being constant?
I'll just say it in general terms.
She has other family stuff that, uh,
goes… takes her in completely the opposite direction.
translation.ko: 그래서 마음과 정반대되는 행동을 하게 되죠

translation.en: And also my health, you know.
I got the, um…
When I got the Parkinson's, it had a double effect on me.
translation.ko: 파킨슨병에 걸렸을 때 이중으로 영향을 받았죠

translation.en: It's funny. You know, today I hardly…
Wow, that's really good. [Jonah] Yeah, you're not even shaking at all.
translation.ko: - 상태가 아주 좋은데요 - 네, 손을 거의 안 떠시네요

translation.en: Would you be willing to follow me around? Because you seem to be helping.
translation.ko: 나 좀 계속 따라다닐래요? 조나 덕분인 것 같은데

translation.en: I'd give you off-- You just have to stay with me every day
translation.ko: 그냥 날마다 저녁 7, 8시까지만 있어줘요 그 후에는 자유예요

translation.en: till about 7:00, 8:00 at night, then you're free--
[Jonah] Don't go on a fucking comedy routine right now.
-Stay on track, bro. -Thank you.
-[Jonah] I know what you're doing. -Thank you.
[Jonah] So the illness and her family stuff.
Yeah.
[Jonah] I can't relate to having Parkinson's,
but do you ever think that can be a crutch
translation.ko: 혹시 그 병이 핑계가 될 수 있다고 생각하세요?

translation.en: to not just make a decision that would be scary emotionally?
translation.ko: 감정적으로 두려운 결정을 피하게 만드는 핑계요

translation.en: Uh, yes, 100%.
I think that crazy part of me--
It takes whatever is happening and uses it to prove its point.
translation.ko: 어떻게든 이유를 찾아내 나 자신을 단념시키죠

translation.en: [Jonah] But that's your Part X preventing you from making that decision.
translation.ko: 근데 결정을 못 하게 방해하는 건 X 파트잖아요

translation.en: Yeah. Yeah.
[Jonah] You know, I think my big fear with, uh, romantic relationships,
translation.ko: 저는 연애를 할 때 뭐가 제일 두려운가 하면…

translation.en: what I'm learning is, is, like, the only way
for them to succeed is for you to be completely vulnerable.
translation.ko: 연애에 성공하려면 연약한 면을 다 드러내야 하죠

translation.en: Yeah.
[Jonah] And humans are so fucked-up, and we just talk ourselves out of happiness so often
translation.ko: 인간은 원래 엉망진창이라서 우울한 말을 달고 사니까

translation.en: that maybe it's worth trying to push you to at least think about it.
translation.ko: 이런 생각이라도 주입하면 좋지 않을까 싶어요

translation.en: Well, you've definitely succeeded in that.
I can't tell you, in the last, let's say, three minutes,
how many jokes I've had to repress.
[Jonah] I get it.
I have the same disease, which is avoid emotion by making jokes.
translation.ko: 저도 농담으로 감정을 감추는 고질병이 있거든요

translation.en: Yeah.
[Jonah] Can I ask a random question, and you can just tell me to fuck off?
translation.ko: 뜬금없는 질문 해도 돼요? 그리고 냉큼 갈게요

translation.en: Yeah.
[Jonah] Do you think…
you will call her
or have some sort of new insight on that relationship?
translation.ko: 그분과의 관계를 새롭게 보는 계기를 얻으셨어요?

translation.en: It… it feels like it, yeah.
Do you mean that, or are you just placating to me?
translation.ko: 정말요? 저 달래려고 하는 말 아니고요?

translation.en: No. I… I mean…
It… it feels like a source of energy that might help me make a decision like this.
translation.ko: 이런 결정을 내리는 데 도움이 될 만한 에너지가 느껴져요

translation.en: [Jonah] Yeah, I mean, I guess I don't feel anything except love for you.
translation.ko: 선생님께 다른 마음은 없어요 오로지 애정뿐이죠

translation.en: I just want…
I… I want you to… be happy.
No, I feel it. I feel that.
See, the thing with me that's not typical is the illness stuff.
translation.ko: 내가 앓고 있는 병은 흔한 게 아니잖아요

translation.en: So I think, now that I'm talking about it,
I think, unconsciously,
I was linking a woman, like a relationship, and being cured.
translation.ko: 여자와의 관계를 병이 낫는 것과 연결 지어 생각했나 봐요

translation.en: [Jonah] But there's no cure for Parkinson's.
Yes. That's correct.
But most people aren't sick like that. Um…
And I've been sick for a long, uh, time.
I grew up in Manhattan, so I was used to going out at night.
translation.ko: 난 맨해튼에서 자라서 밤에 외출하는 게 익숙했어요

translation.en: By the time I was 21, 22, we would go out at least one out of every two nights.
translation.ko: 21살, 22살쯤에는 최소 이틀에 한 번은 놀러 나갔죠

translation.en: It was Friday. I was supposed to meet these two women at some bar downtown.
translation.ko: 금요일에 시내 술집에서 여자 둘을 만나기로 돼 있었어요

translation.en: I said, "Great, I'll be down there in an hour."
translation.ko: 나는 한 시간 내로 가겠다고 했죠

translation.en: And I had been taking a nap.
I went back to sleep. I said, "Let me just continue this nap for 20 minutes,
then I'll take a cab downtown."
I woke up Monday morning.
And I said, "I am really fucked. Something is terribly wrong."
translation.ko: 큰일 났다 싶더군요 문제가 심각한 것 같았어요

translation.en: Complete exhaustion. Like an exhaustion so deep…
Let me put it this way.
If I had to go to the cleaners, right across the street from my house,
translation.ko: 길 건너 맞은편에 있는 세탁소에 가야 할 때면

translation.en: I would have to think, "Okay, can I do this or not?"
translation.ko: 곰곰이 생각해 봐야 했죠 '다녀올 수 있으려나?'

translation.en: "Do I have the… the strength to do it?"
But this was not me. I was, like, a very hyperactive person.
translation.ko: 근데 원래는 안 그랬어요 아주 활동적인 사람이었죠

translation.en: So then I went to a neurologist.
In one meeting, he told me, "Oh, you have cervical stenosis,
translation.ko: 딱 한 번 진찰하더니 경추 협착이라고 하더군요

translation.en: you need immediate surgery, and you have Parkinson's disease."
[Jonah] What did it feel like that day?
See, this is my real Shadow coming out
when you're gonna see what my handwriting looks like.
[Jonah] Why?
Because it's barely legible.
I don't even like looking at it.
I used to be very good with my hands.
I was very good at basketball, but anything, I was dexterous.
translation.ko: 농구도 아주 잘했죠 손으로 하는 건 뭐든 잘했어요

translation.en: Now,
well, it speaks for itself. [chuckles]
But what I try to do when I get that fear,
I try to see my Shadow right at that moment.
translation.ko: 난 그 순간에 그림자를 똑바로 보려 노력해요

translation.en: "He looks cachectic." You know what that means?
translation.ko: 그럼 그림자는 악액질이 되죠 뭔지 알아요?

translation.en: -Emaciated? -[Stutz] Yeah, emaciated.
-Yeah. -[Stutz] That's how my Shadow looks now.
It's like I'll fall apart.
[Jonah] Do you think medical issues can lead to a lonelier existence?
-Yes. [splutters] Yes. -[Jonah] Why?
It was, literally, for a while there, I was afraid to go outside.
translation.ko: 한동안은 말 그대로 밖에 나가기가 두려웠거든요

translation.en: [Jonah] Did you ever think about having kids?
Yeah, all the time, but now… it's too late now.
I… and I wouldn't want to have a kid now.
[Jonah] Hmm. Why not?
I'm still so weak.
If I have to get out of this chair, I have to think about it.
translation.ko: 이 의자에서 일어날 때도 고민부터 해야 한다고요

translation.en: There'll be so many moments
translation.ko: 내 힘으로 할 수 없는 일을

translation.en: where I wasn't actually capable of being part of the thing.
translation.ko: 내 힘으로 할 수 없는 일을 해야 하는 순간이 많을 텐데

translation.en: -[Jonah] Hmm. -I don't think it'd be a great idea.
[Jonah] That fucking sucks, man.
[chuckles] Yeah.
Yeah.
[splutters] But if that hadn't happened,
