the last bit of information I've been developing, I wouldn't have gotten.
translation.ko: 내가 고안 중이던 마지막 개념은 탄생하지 못했을 거예요

translation.en: It's like every time I get pushed down and crushed,
I seem to get more information.
Parkinson's has made me aware of time. Like, really aware of it.
translation.ko: 파킨슨병 때문에 시간을 뼈저리게 의식하게 됐죠

translation.en: My sense of mission, my sense of this is what I'm supposed to do,
translation.ko: 내게 주어진 사명 해야 할 일이 있다는 생각이

translation.en: that got much stronger in me.
If I don't do that, I start to think about, "Oh, shit, this happened to me."
translation.ko: 넋을 놨다간 이런 생각에 빠지죠 '재수 없이 병에 걸리다니!'

translation.en: "What a drag." You know, it makes life harder.
Then you go into this whole pity party thing. It's a complete waste of time.
translation.ko: 그러다 신세 한탄에 빠지는 거죠 다 시간 낭비예요

translation.en: [Jonah] Do you ever get in that zone? The pity party zone?
Yeah, I get in it all the time,
but I'm very fast at getting out of it.
translation.ko: 근데 난 거기서 아주 빨리 빠져나와요

translation.en: [Jonah] In putting the movie together,
I started using your drawings to display the tools,
translation.ko: 툴을 보여드리기 위해 선생님 그림을 활용하게 됐는데

translation.en: and they are a bit shaky,
and I wanted to know if it was okay with you if I did that?
translation.ko: 제가 선생님 그림을 써도 괜찮을지 여쭤보고 싶었어요

translation.en: Oh, it would be great. Definitely do it.
And if it's shaky, it's even better.
Because the whole premise of this is we're not gonna win every time,
translation.ko: 이 모든 것의 전제는 우리가 매번 이길 수 없고

translation.en: we certainly can't be perfect, we can't control it,
translation.ko: 완벽할 수도 없다는 거니까요 통제할 수도 없어요

translation.en: but we have an unstoppable will to go forward.
translation.ko: 대신 우린 전진하려는 끝없는 의지가 있죠

translation.en: And this reminds you of it.
Each card has a little bit of a different approach to basically the same goal,
translation.ko: 카드마다 목표는 같지만 접근 방식이 조금씩 달라요

translation.en: which is, "Schmuck, take action, no matter how frightened you are."
translation.ko: 이런 거죠, '멍청아, 움직여! 겁나도 행동에 옮기라고'

translation.en: [Jonah] That reminds me of Radical Acceptance, which is a big one
and really helps me work through a lot.
translation.ko: 제 삶에 큰 도움이 되는 툴이죠

translation.en: That's right. That's exactly right.
Here's the thing. Every event has something in it that you can learn from.
translation.ko: 명심해요, 어떤 사건이든 그 안에는 배울 점이 있어요

translation.en: When something goes wrong,
anybody can say, "Well, it's not that bad. I'll recover from it tomorrow."
translation.ko: '괜찮아, 내일 만회하면 되지' 이런 말은 누구나 해요

translation.en: That's not good enough.
You have to create a reflex to squeeze the juice out.
translation.ko: 즙을 짜내려면 반사적 행동이 나와야 하죠

translation.en: Squeezing the juice means finding something meaningful.
translation.ko: 즙을 짠다는 건 의미를 찾는다는 뜻이에요

translation.en: It's trying to find the state of not getting into a lot of negativity
translation.ko: 너무 부정적인 생각에 빠져들지 않도록 노력하면서

translation.en: but actually training yourself to say, "What am I gonna do about it now?"
translation.ko: 이렇게 되뇌도록 훈련하는 거죠 '이제 뭘 하면 될까?'

translation.en: I gotta do some push-ups.
Is there anything that's, you know, strong enough to support my weight?
translation.ko: 내 몸무게를 지탱할 만한 물건이 있을까요?

translation.en: -[Jonah] You wanna do push-ups? -Yeah. I'm getting stiff.
translation.ko: - 팔 굽혀 펴기 하시게요? - 네, 몸이 굳어서

translation.en: You can do it on the dolly if you want. The push-ups.
translation.ko: 돌리에 기대서 하셔도 돼요 팔 굽혀 펴기요

translation.en: [Jonah] Careful, Phil.
I've never done this in front of this many people.
translation.ko: 이렇게 여러 사람 앞에서는 처음 해봐요

translation.en: Even if I do, like, ten of these… This is good for this.
translation.ko: 10개 하면 끝이지만요 팔 굽혀 펴기 하기 딱이네

translation.en: -Can I take this home? -[all laugh]
It's the most expensive push-up--
[Stutz] You're not allowed to make judgements.
You're not allowed to tell yourself anything negative.
It doesn't mean you're stupid. It doesn't mean there isn't something negative there.
translation.ko: 본인이 멍청해서가 아니에요 나쁜 일이 있을 순 있지만

translation.en: You're not allowed to go through that. It goes against what we're doing.
translation.ko: 우리 목적에 배치되는 반추 행위는 금지라는 거예요

translation.en: Number two, obviously, you want to find something that's positive about it.
translation.ko: 두 번째로 할 일은 긍정적인 부분을 찾는 거죠

translation.en: Dude, you're crushing it.
Well, when you do 100 of these a day, you get stronger. [chuckles]
-You do 100 of those a day? -Probably.
Yeah, because every time I stiffen up, I can't move like I should.
translation.ko: 몸이 경직될 때마다 제대로 움직일 수가 없거든요

translation.en: Yeah, now it's a lot looser, but, you know, I get like this, I can't move either of them.
translation.ko: 이제 훨씬 부드러워졌네요 근데 이렇게는 전혀 못 움직여요

translation.en: So I discovered this.
Maybe this'll spread the word if you guys don't cut it out of the film.
So squeezing the juice out of the lemon
means you have not only the will to do this,
translation.ko: 이 일을 할 의지가 있을 뿐만 아니라

translation.en: but you have some faith in it. There's something there that's valuable.
translation.ko: 믿음도 있다는 뜻이에요 가치 있는 일이라고 믿는 거죠

translation.en: And what happens is everything starts to become more meaningful.
translation.ko: 그러면 세상만사가 더 의미 있어지기 시작해요

translation.en: You don't get to the world of meaning through big things.
translation.ko: 거창한 일에선 의미를 찾을 수 없어요

translation.en: You get it through small things.
I feel better.
-I feel loose now. -I do that for my mind.
translation.ko: - 이제 풀어진 것 같아요 - 엄마한테 해드릴래요

translation.en: -Oh. -Sorry. [chuckles]
[Stutz] You need to look at all events as having value.
translation.ko: 모든 사건은 그 나름의 가치가 있다고 봐야 해요

translation.en: If you can do that, then you're in a zone of tremendous opportunity.
translation.ko: 그렇게 할 수 있다면 엄청난 기회의 장에 진입하게 돼요

translation.en: That's all I have to say on that.
[Jonah] You fucking dropped the mic. That was amazing.
That's one of the best. That's a Stutz greatest hit.
-Yeah, it is one of the best. -[Jonah] I had to use that last night.
Oh yeah? How did it work out?
[Jonah] So I had an anxiety attack, and I couldn't sleep.
translation.ko: 불안 발작 증세 때문에 잠을 못 자겠더라고요

translation.en: And instead of having more anxiety
about how I'm not getting enough sleep for the next day's work,
I used Radical Acceptance and was able to actually use that time
translation.ko: '적극적 수용' 툴을 활용해 그 시간을 유용하게 썼죠

translation.en: to come up with more new ideas for the shoot today.
translation.ko: 오늘 촬영에 쓸 새 아이디어를 고안했어요

translation.en: Yeah, well, you did a good job.
Don't fuck this up now.
Did I say anything about Cain and Abel?
Maybe not. [Jonah] You went to high school with them?
[Stutz] I actually remember… I think I was nine. It wasn't like today
translation.ko: 내가 9살 때쯤이었을 거예요 지금과 달리 그때는 비행기를 타는 게 큰일이었죠

translation.en: where you just hop on a plane. It was a big deal.
translation.ko: 지금과 달리 그때는 비행기를 타는 게 큰일이었죠

translation.en: And it was-- You couldn't see shit. It was one of those overcast days.
translation.ko: 그날은 아무것도 안 보였어요 구름이 잔뜩 낀 날이었죠

translation.en: My father was talking to me about some of this stuff… [chuckles]
translation.ko: 아버지가 이런저런 얘기 속에 하신 말씀이 있어요

translation.en: …and he said, "Don't worry."
translation.ko: 아버지가 이런저런 얘기 속에 하신 말씀이 있어요 '걱정 마, 이 구름 위로 올라가면 태양이 나올 거야'

translation.en: "We'll get above this, and the sun will be out."
translation.ko: '걱정 마, 이 구름 위로 올라가면 태양이 나올 거야'

translation.en: [splutters] I just couldn't believe it.
I thought, "What, are you crazy?"
This-- How could the sun still be up there
translation.ko: 어떻게 태양이 떠 있을 수 있냐고요

translation.en: when it's so dense, and I'm seeing all these clouds?
And then, I remember the exact moment
the sun broke through the cloud, and I was so amazed.
translation.ko: 햇빛이 구름 사이로 쏟아져서 얼마나 깜짝 놀랐는지 몰라요

translation.en: It's like the whole model of the universe became different because…
translation.ko: 내가 상상하던 우주의 원형이 송두리째 바뀐 것 같았어요

translation.en: The importance of it was I was no longer judging the nature of reality
translation.ko: 중요한 점은 진짜 현실이 뭔지 판단하지 않게 됐다는 거죠

translation.en: by my experiences in the last five minutes.
The sun is always up there.
The cloud is always over here, blocking the sun.
translation.ko: 구름은 늘 이곳에서 태양을 가리고 있죠

translation.en: If you can't break through, you think it's a very bad day.
translation.ko: 그 구름을 뚫지 못하면 일진이 사납다고 여겨요

translation.en: In fact, you think it's a very bad life.
Every thought you have is gonna affect your mood.
translation.ko: 여러분이 하는 모든 생각은 기분에 영향을 미쳐요

translation.en: Every thought you have is gonna be either positive or negative.
translation.ko: 긍정적 또는 부정적 영향을 주게 마련이죠

translation.en: So the Grateful Flow wants to choose the positives.
translation.ko: 그럴 때 '감사의 흐름'은 긍정적인 부분을 보게 해줘요

translation.en: Part X wants you to have the negative flow, so it'll create the cloud up there
translation.ko: X 파트는 부정적 흐름을 조장해서 먹구름을 만들어 내죠

translation.en: so you can't see the sun.
You forget that it's actually sunny up there.
The question becomes, "How do you penetrate the cloud?"
translation.ko: 관건은 이 먹구름을 어떻게 뚫고 나가느냐인데

translation.en: And the answer is, "With gratefulness."
It gives you the sensation, the feeling,
that there's always something up there positive even if you can't see it at all.
translation.ko: 눈에는 보이지 않아도 긍정적인 무언가가 있다는 걸요

translation.en: But you have to have a mechanism. That's where the tool comes in.
The Grateful Flow is not the things you're grateful for.
The Grateful Flow is the process of creating these things.
translation.ko: 감사할 대상을 만들어 내는 과정을 의미해요

translation.en: So close your eyes.
Now, what you want to do is you say two or three, at most four,
translation.ko: 지금부터 할 일은 2, 3개에서 최대 4개를 말하는 거예요

translation.en: things you're grateful for.
The smaller the thing, the better,
because it forces you to concentrate gratefulness.
You wanna do it nice and slow. You want to feel the gratefulness.
translation.ko: 천천히 잘 생각해 보세요 감사하는 마음을 느끼는 거예요

translation.en: I'm grateful for my nephews.
I'm grateful for surfing.
I'm grateful…
for my dog.
I'm grateful for you.
[Stutz] Okay, now, keep naming things, but don't say them out loud.
translation.ko: 대상을 계속 생각해 봐요 소리 내서 말하지 말고요

translation.en: Just keep creating that stream of gratefulness.
Good.
The next thing you do is you feel
translation.ko: 이제는 고마운 생각이 계속해서 떠오를 것 같아도 거기서 멈춰요

translation.en: that you're going to create another grateful thought, but you don't.
translation.ko: 고마운 생각이 계속해서 떠오를 것 같아도 거기서 멈춰요

translation.en: You block it. So all you feel is the force that would create a grateful thought,
translation.ko: 차단하는 거죠, 고마운 생각을 만들어 내는 힘만 느끼면 돼요

translation.en: and as it gets stronger and stronger, you feel taken over by it.
translation.ko: 그 힘이 강해질수록 그 힘에 잠식되는 느낌일 거예요

translation.en: That's the Grateful Flow. That was excellent. Did you feel anything?
translation.ko: 그게 '감사의 흐름'이죠 정말 잘했어요, 느낀 게 있나요?

translation.en: I felt everything kind of just… slow down.
translation.ko: 뭐랄까, 세상 모든 게 느려진 것 같았어요

translation.en: And I felt a warmth.
-[Stutz] Mm-hmm. -Like in a sense of comfort.
[Stutz] That's pretty good.
The key is not saying the same things over and over that you're grateful for.
translation.ko: 같은 대상에 연거푸 감사하다고 말하지 않는 게 중요해요

translation.en: You wanna make it a creative act.
When you have to dig and work on it to find these things,
translation.ko: 감사한 대상을 찾기 위해 열심히 파고들고 노력할 때

translation.en: that process itself will change your mood.
translation.ko: 그 과정 자체가 여러분의 기분을 바꿔줄 거예요

translation.en: The classic time to use it is when your thoughts are out of control.
translation.ko: 생각이 통제가 안 될 때 보통 이 방법을 써요

translation.en: The worst thing to do is argue with them.
'Cause its effect on you is terrible, and it does nothing for you.
translation.ko: 그때의 여파는 너무 끔찍해요 본인한테 득 될 게 없죠

translation.en: But gratefulness is not just, "I'm lucky somebody helped me," or whatever.
translation.ko: '누가 날 도와줘서 다행이야' 이건 감사하는 마음이 아니에요

translation.en: Gratefulness is the state you want to be in
translation.ko: 최대한 자주 유지하고 싶은 마음 상태죠

translation.en: as often as you possibly can be in it, because it's the state that connects you…
translation.ko: 최대한 자주 유지하고 싶은 마음 상태죠 그래야 태양에 닿을 수…

translation.en: It's the state that breaks through the cloud.
And once you're up there, you're in a different world.
translation.ko: 일단 뚫고 올라가면 다른 세상이 펼쳐져요

translation.en: What Part X does is to say you shouldn't be grateful. It says, "You got screwed."
translation.ko: X 파트는 고마워하지 말라며 이렇게 말해요, '넌 이미 망했어'

translation.en: "You're a victim. You didn't get enough."
"Why should you be grateful for what you have?"
That's the devil talking. That's classic Part X.
translation.ko: 악마의 속삭임이죠 X 파트는 늘 이래요

translation.en: I don't talk to you about your Parkinson's a ton.
translation.ko: 저는 선생님 앞에서 파킨슨병 얘기를 잘 안 하는데

translation.en: And I wonder what part of it is my fear of just not wanting to acknowledge
translation.ko: 어떤 부분 때문에 그 사실을 외면하려 하는 건지 궁금해요

translation.en: my own fears around that stuff.
translation.ko: 전 왜 그런 것들을 인정하기가 두려울까요?

translation.en: Yeah. I mean, my advice to you is assume that you're probably underestimating me,
translation.ko: 이렇게 생각하면 좋을 것 같아요 조나가 날 과소평가하는 걸지도 모른다고 말이죠

translation.en: um, because I continue every day to make adjustments,
translation.ko: 난 날마다 수정에 수정을 거듭하는 사람이거든요

translation.en: and a lot of them are very helpful.
I don't know. I'm funny, you know?
That's not the kind of thing that I think about a lot.
translation.ko: 그런 부정적인 생각은 많이 안 하는 것 같아요

translation.en: I think about the future,
but mostly, my biggest fear is not getting enough done before I die.
translation.ko: 하지만 평상시에 내가 제일 두려운 건 할 일을 많이 남겨 두고 죽는 거예요

translation.en: -Hmm. -'Cause I got so much--
The stuff we talked about here is maybe, I don't know, 10% of it.
translation.ko: 우리가 여기서 얘기한 것들은 전체의 10%에 불과할 거예요

translation.en: A sliver, yeah.
Yeah, I think death in itself is a really…
translation.ko: 맞아요, 죽음이란 건 원래 그 자체로…

translation.en: [exhales] It's a complex subject for everybody.
For me, I am…
very scared to lose you particularly.
translation.ko: 특히 선생님을 잃게 될까 봐 너무 겁이 나요

translation.en: Not that that's on my mind all the time,
but, like, you are the person I go to for life advice
translation.ko: 선생님은 제가 인생 조언이 필요할 때 찾는 분이잖아요

translation.en: and for a sense of comfort that there is ways through things.
translation.ko: 저를 위로해 주시는 분이기도 하고요 문제 해결 방법은 늘 있다면서요

translation.en: And at the same time,
you… the only time I've had massive experience with death,
translation.ko: 제가 딱 한 번 죽음과 관련된 일로 버거워할 때

translation.en: you were the person that got me through that as well.
translation.ko: 그 시간을 이겨 내게 해준 분도 선생님이에요

translation.en: -You're talking about your brother? -Yeah. Yeah.
And when he passed away unexpectedly a few years ago,
translation.ko: 몇 년 전에 난데없이 세상을 떠난 우리 형이요

translation.en: and before I made this movie, I didn't know
translation.ko: 이 영화를 만들기 전에는 선생님 동생이 돌아가신 줄 몰랐어요

translation.en: that you had lost your brother.
You told a story about where you were that day.
-Oh yeah. -You knew the spot where you were.
You went to school that day and all those things and…
I spend a lot of my life avoiding thinking about that day,
translation.ko: 근데 저는 웬만하면 그날을 생각하지 않으려고 해요

translation.en: and I went to your office that morning.
translation.ko: 그날 아침에 저는 선생님 상담실에 왔었죠

translation.en: It was definitely the most intense day in my life.
It's definitely, like, the most shook-up I've ever been.
translation.ko: 제가 태어나서 겪은 일 중에 제일 충격적이었죠

translation.en: One of the things I remember was, that day, you said, "Give me your phone,"
translation.ko: 그날 기억나는 일 중의 하나는 선생님이 저한테 전화기를 달라고 하시더니

translation.en: and you took a picture of me.
And I, like, wondered why you did that?
It is very rare in life that you get a chance to record something
translation.ko: 인생에서 절정의 순간을 기록할 기회는 흔치 않죠

translation.en: at the climactic, you know, most important moment.
translation.ko: 삶에서 제일 중요한 순간을 포착해 두었다가

translation.en: And then you come back to it.
Whether it's in a week or a year, it doesn't matter.
You… you have, um, a… There's a time gap.
And in that time gap,
you actually experience the forces of healing, of recovery.
translation.ko: 사람은 치유의 힘과 회복하는 힘을 경험하게 되죠

translation.en: Yeah, I… I haven't looked at this picture
in four years.
But I, like, printed it out, because I wanted to show you and look at it.
translation.ko: 출력해서 가져왔어요 선생님과 함께 보고 싶어서요

translation.en: You haven't looked at it for four years?
In a good way…
it's like it's… I look stripped of everything fake.
translation.ko: 거짓된 것이 전부 다 벗겨져 나간 모습 같아요

translation.en: And there is an oddly serene look on my face.
-[Stutz] There is. -Which is, like, so bizarre.
But maybe because it, like, demolished…
translation.ko: 근데 전부 다 떨어져 나가서 그런지도 모르겠어요

translation.en: everything that didn't matter.
[Stutz] It demolished everything you thought you needed but you don't need.
translation.ko: 필요하다고 착각했던 게 모두 떨어져 나간 거죠

translation.en: That's the picture of somebody who's gone through hell
translation.ko: 저 사진 속의 주인공은 지옥 같은 시간을 지나서

translation.en: and came out the other side and is really okay,
translation.ko: 반대편에 도달한 사람이에요 지금은 안정을 찾았죠

translation.en: in a very nondramatic way, which I like.
That's a picture of victory, even though it might not look like it.
translation.ko: 그렇게 안 보일 수도 있지만 승리의 사진이에요

translation.en: Loss Processing is a tool that allows you to process loss, right?
translation.ko: '상실 대처법'은 상실에 대처할 때 활용하는 툴이에요, 그렇죠?

translation.en: And most people are very bad at it.
Not only are they bad when there's a loss and they get depressed or bereft,
translation.ko: 상실을 경험하면 우울감에 빠져 희망을 놔버리죠

translation.en: but before there's a loss, they're just worrying about a loss.
translation.ko: 게다가 상실이 일어나기 전에 걱정부터 해요

translation.en: The goal of this is to get what's called the potency of nonattachment.
translation.ko: 이 툴의 목적은 애착을 버리는 힘을 얻는 거죠

translation.en: That means I can pursue something, but I'm willing not to have it.
translation.ko: 얻으려고 할 순 있지만 기꺼이 갖지 않겠다는 뜻이에요

translation.en: I still wanna pursue it. I want to pursue it really hard.
But I'm also willing to lose.
The first thing I want you to do is pick out something that you feel you've become too attached to.
translation.ko: 우선, 지나치게 애착이 생긴 것 같은 대상을 가려내요

translation.en: It could be a person, a job, something small. It doesn't matter.
translation.ko: 사람 또는 일일 수도 있어요 사소한 것도 상관없어요

translation.en: But something where you're loath to let go of it.
translation.ko: 놓아버리기 싫은 그 대상을 찾는 거예요

translation.en: You're afraid, if you let go of it, something terrible's gonna happen.
translation.ko: 놓아버리면 나쁜 일이 생길까 봐 두려운 대상요

translation.en: -You have it? -Mm-hmm.
[Stutz] Okay.
Now imagine you're grasping this thing.
And if it's not a material thing, it doesn't matter.
Just imagine you're grasping it,
like you're grasping onto a branch on a tree.
It's scary. You're afraid to let go.
But you let go anyway.
And when you let go, you start to fall.
It's not a bad sensation though.
The falling is actually kind of slow and gentle, to your surprise,
but you're dropping down.
And you say, "I'm willing to lose everything."
translation.ko: 이제 이렇게 말하세요 '난 모든 걸 잃을 각오가 돼 있어'

translation.en: And you have to say it silently,
but you want to really feel the, uh, intent behind that.
translation.ko: 나지막이 읊조려야 해요 그 말에 숨은 의도를 제대로 느끼는 겁니다

translation.en: And the moment you say that,
you hit the surface of a sun that was down there below you,
translation.ko: 아래에 있던 태양의 표면에 닿게 되고

translation.en: and your body burns up.
Now, at that point, you have lost everything,
because the instrument of possession is your physical body.
translation.ko: 인간은 육체라는 도구가 있어야 소유할 수 있으니까요

translation.en: So if your physical body's burnt up, you're just one sunbeam
translation.ko: 육체가 불타 없어진 조나는 빛줄기에 불과해요

translation.en: amongst all these other sunbeams.
You're radiating outward in all directions,
and what you're radiating is a very loving, giving, outflowing sensation.
translation.ko: 깊이 사랑하고 베푸는 마음 거침없는 감정을 퍼뜨리고 있어요

translation.en: And then you look around,
and you see, all around you, an infinite number of other suns,
translation.ko: 무수히 많은 태양이 주위를 에워싸고 있죠

translation.en: just like the one you're inside of, all of which are radiating outwards.
translation.ko: 내가 속한 태양처럼 모든 태양이 빛을 뿜어내요

translation.en: And then you hear the suns, all of them, saying in unison,
"We are everywhere."
This world is called a sun world.
All you can do is give. You can't take.
translation.ko: 여기선 줄 수만 있고 취할 순 없죠

translation.en: You can't grasp. You can't hold on to anything. It's just impossible.
translation.ko: 그 무엇도 손에 넣거나 붙잡을 수 없어요

translation.en: Now you can open your eyes.
How'd it feel?
[Jonah] Great.
-You don't wanna say anything else? -Yeah, I do.
translation.ko: - 더 하고 싶은 말 없어요? - 있어요

translation.en: Which is, I'm very good at nonattachment
translation.ko: 저는 애착을 버리는 일을 원체 잘하는 사람이에요

translation.en: to, like, a job or an identity or a beef with someone.
translation.ko: 일이나 정체성에 집착하지 않죠 불만이 생겨도 잘 잊고요

translation.en: I can get there and use the tools to get there.
When it comes to things like a romantic relationship
or a family member that I love,
the idea of losing those things,
I struggle with that concept.
Think about it like this. You're not trying to become nonattached.
translation.ko: 이렇게 생각해 봐요 애착을 버리려 노력하는 게 아니라

translation.en: You're trying to move towards nonattachment
translation.ko: 애착이 없는 상태로 나아가려고 노력하는 거죠

translation.en: every time you get scared of a loss.
For most people,
they've never been nonattached for one second in their whole life.
translation.ko: 평생 한순간도 애착을 버리지 못하고 살아요

translation.en: So even the fact that they can move towards that is… is helpful for them.
translation.ko: 그러니 애착 없는 상태로 나아가는 것만으로도 도움이 돼요

translation.en: If you're human, it's not possible.
It wouldn't even be good if you were totally nonattached.
translation.ko: 애착이 아예 없는 건 좋지 않아요

translation.en: That makes a lot of sense.
So the goal is not to become completely nonattached.
translation.ko: 애착이 아예 없는 사람이 되는 게 목표가 아니라

translation.en: It's work towards no one person, place, or thing leaving you
translation.ko: 노력이 중요하다는 거잖아요 어떤 사람, 장소, 사물이 없어져도

translation.en: can completely take away your whole existence and your sense of wholeness.
translation.ko: 난 완전한 존재라는 감각을 지키려 노력하라는 거죠

translation.en: That's correct.
I don't wanna leave anything in the shadows,
because I don't want it to become this, like, thing that eats at me.
translation.ko: 그림자 때문에 초조한 기분을 느끼고 싶지 않거든요

translation.en: And even your fears, I think, when you say them,
or your pain, when you say it, does set you free in a lot of ways.
translation.ko: 소리 내어 말하면 여러 가지 면에서 자유로워져요

translation.en: [Stutz] Yeah, it does.
[Jonah] And I use Loss Processing, and it really helps.
translation.ko: 저는 상실 대처법의 도움을 많이 받아요

translation.en: I wanna be like a monk and be like, "These tools just help it all dissolve,"
translation.ko: 수도승처럼 이 툴을 써서 모든 문제를 없애면 좋겠는데

translation.en: but I still feel that pain every day.
-You know? -Yeah.
[Jonah] I still miss my brother.
[Stutz] Yeah, you will for a very long time.
But let me put it this way.
Death is not a permanent condition.
You can… you can be afraid of death, that's fine,
as long as you feel something after death.
translation.ko: 죽음 이후에 있는 무언가를 느낄 수 있다면요

translation.en: And that's rebirth.
The idea that rebirth is possible from the very worst,
translation.ko: 환생이 있다는 생각은 최악의 상황에서 가능해요

translation.en: the dregs of the world, dregs of experience,
translation.ko: 세상의 찌꺼기 경험의 찌꺼기가 있어야 하죠

translation.en: and you can make something cyclically come alive again.
translation.ko: 그래야 무언가를 주기적으로 되살릴 수 있어요

translation.en: That's the closest a human being can get to God.
translation.ko: 인간이 신에게 가장 가까이 다가가는 길이죠

translation.en: Yeah, I understand it's just a reality and that life just does go on.
translation.ko: 그건 알겠어요, 다만 그 삶에서도 현실은 끊임없이 계속되잖아요

translation.en: But there's very few people on that list that I just don't want to fucking lose so…
translation.ko: 근데 절대 잃고 싶지 않은 소수의 사람이 있죠

translation.en: I don't want to lose you either.
What do I do? [chuckles]
I think we should get married.
-I want a prenup. -[Jonah laughs]
Oh, yeah, here we go, some of the good ones. These are so sick.
translation.ko: - 아, 여기 몇 개 있네요 - 진짜 멋있는데요?

translation.en: [Stutz] Yeah, this…
[Jonah] One of the things that this movie is accomplishing for me while I'm making it
translation.ko: 이 영화를 제작하면서 제가 깨달은 것 중 하나는요

translation.en: is that I used to think that the people I look up to
translation.ko: 제가 오해했다는 거예요 제가 존경하는 사람들한테는

translation.en: are absolved of the problems that I have.
translation.ko: 저 같은 문제가 없는 줄 알았거든요

translation.en: [laughs] I'm sorry.
I understand. I under--
[Jonah] It's absurd. I know. It really is absurd. It's not…
translation.ko: 말도 안 되죠 터무니없는 소리라는 거 알아요

translation.en: -You're laughing 'cause it's absurd. -Yeah.
Right. And I think it's good for people to see
translation.ko: 다 똑같다는 걸 알게 돼서 다행이에요

translation.en: that you, for me, are someone who's created these things,
translation.ko: 이런 툴을 만든 선생님 같은 분도

translation.en: and I think it's important that people who we look up to
translation.ko: 그리고 우리가 존경하는 사람들도 예외 없이

translation.en: aren't exempt from all the problems that we ourselves have.
translation.ko: 우리와 똑같은 문제를 갖고 있다는 사실은 중요해요

translation.en: You are still in the struggle and in the fight of being a human
translation.ko: 선생님도 여전히 한 인간으로서 분투하고 계시죠

translation.en: just like everybody else is.
Your whole thing is that you're never exempt from the pain
translation.ko: 선생님도 고통에서 영원히 벗어날 수 없잖아요

translation.en: or the uncertainty or the constant work.
translation.ko: 불확실성, 끝없는 노력을 피할 수 없죠

translation.en: And I think there's something beautiful about seeing your vulnerability,
for me, that dissects
translation.ko: 덕분에 저는 모든 문제를 해결한 사람은 절대 없을 거라는 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: that there will never be anyone that has it all figured out.
translation.ko: 모든 문제를 해결한 사람은 절대 없을 거라는 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: Yeah.
That's the secret of life.
-As far as I'm concerned. -Is what?
[Stutz] Accepting that you won't figure it out ever. Nobody else will figure it out.
translation.ko: 그 누구도 모든 문제를 해결할 순 없음을 받아들이는 거요

translation.en: Happiness depends on how you accept that
translation.ko: 우리의 행복은 그 진리를 어떻게 받아들이고

translation.en: and what you do about it.
But first is accept it, because if you don't accept it,
translation.ko: 우선 받아들이는 게 관건이죠 받아들이지 못하면

translation.en: you have this thing in your mind that I can get over it
or under it and eliminate it, and you can't.
translation.ko: 없앨 수 있을 줄 아는데 그건 불가능하거든요

translation.en: This is such a great moment right now.
Could you guys stay just like this, and I'm gonna go home and go to sleep?
translation.ko: 다들 그대로 있어줄래요? 난 집에 가서 좀 잘게요

translation.en: When I get back here in the morning, I want to find you just…
translation.ko: 아침에 다시 왔을 때 이 모습 그대로면 좋겠어요

translation.en: -Would that be reasonable? -[Jonah] Yeah.
Are you tired?
-Yeah, I'm kind of tired. -[Jonah] All right, go lay down.
translation.ko: - 네, 좀 피곤하네요 - 그럼 가서 누우세요

translation.en: What do you see when you close your eyes?
I see an ocean.
And it's a beautiful beach, and the waves are--
They're not huge waves. They're just perfectly formed waves.
translation.ko: 큰 파도는 아니고 완벽한 형태를 갖췄어요

translation.en: And they're running up and down my body now.
[Jonah] Is the water warm or cold?
Warm.
You know what my mother said when my brother, um, went into the hospital?
translation.ko: 동생이 병원에 입원했을 때 어머니가 뭐라고 하셨게요?

translation.en: She said, "He went… he… he entered it as an infant,"
or, you know, he was three,
"but three months later," I think it was three months later when he died,
translation.ko: '석 달 후에 보니…' 석 달 후에 동생이 죽었나 그래요

translation.en: "he was a grown man."
So something… He was transformed.
It made me feel so, um, sad, but also,
Also in awe, I guess.
-[Jonah] Can you see him now? -[exhales] What?
[Jonah] You see him now?
Yeah, I mean, it's… He… he's not particularly--
I feel that that is my brother, but, you know, he feels like…
translation.ko: 동생이라는 느낌은 들어요 근데 지금 동생은

translation.en: He feels like he's your age, actually.
He says… [inhales]
…he didn't give me enough advance warning about his death.
translation.ko: 나한테 자기 죽음에 대해 충분히 경고해 주지 못했대요

translation.en: He's saying…
He's saying it didn't bother him that much. He… he knew about it.
translation.ko: 자기는 죽음을 예감해서 별로 괴롭지 않았다네요

translation.en: I don't see how he could have… told me.
translation.ko: 자기가 나한테 어떻게 말할 수 있었다는 건지

translation.en: Maybe. I don't know.
I swear, I know this is impossible, but I'm having this feeling
translation.ko: 불가능한 일인 건 알지만 지금 기분은 꼭

translation.en: as if I'm flying.
[Jonah] How does it feel?
Great.
Can I, uh, sit up?
[Jonah] You're flying through the air?
Well, I'm… I'm hoping that'll stop when my feet…
[splutters] Are you insured for that?
-[Jonah laughs] Yeah, you wanna sit up? -Yeah.
[Jonah] Yeah, sit up. Of course.
-This is a nice room. -[Jonah laughs]
Wow.
This is the real challenge for me every day, is to get out of bed.
translation.ko: 매일 침대에서 일어나기가 얼마나 힘든지 몰라요

translation.en: Maybe it's just an attempt to gain control over me or…
translation.ko: 날 좌지우지하려고 수를 쓰는 것 같기도 하고…

translation.en: I'm not sure. Why did you?
[Jonah] All those reasons.
-Should somebody grab your medicine? -Yeah.
I like the background the way it is,
because a lot of people have dreams
where they… they have… they discover another bedroom in their house,
translation.ko: 자기 집에서 또 다른 침실을 발견한다거나

translation.en: or sometimes they'll discover, like, a whole huge thing.
What it really means in the dream world is you're becoming more conscious.
Your view of the universe is expanding.
So people have dreams that there's a room in their house that's not there,
translation.ko: 자기 집에 실제로 없는 방이 존재하는 꿈을 꾸는 게

translation.en: and it means their mind is expanding or they're growing?
Yeah. Mm-hmm.
That's crazy.
…won't recover. I say, "Do what the fuck I tell you."
"Do exactly what I tell you. I guarantee you'll feel better."
[Jonah] Wait, I have an idea.
Yeah, go ahead.
[Jonah] Since we already shot the opening of the movie,
this might be for the end of the movie,
translation.ko: 이걸 끝에 넣으면 될 것 같아요

translation.en: if we're saying why I made this movie now, after all we've been through.
translation.ko: 선생님과 상담한 지는 한참 됐는데 이제야 제가 영화를 찍는 이유 말이에요

translation.en: That's good.
See if you can… just really fast,
see if you can say the beginning, and then, right after that, say the end.
translation.ko: 시작 부분에 바로 이어서 끝부분을 이야기할 수 있을지

translation.en: I'm making this movie
because I want to give therapy and the tools I've learned in therapy
translation.ko: 제가 심리 치료를 하면서 배운 툴을 알리고 싶어서예요

translation.en: to as many people as possible through a film.
translation.ko: 영화라는 매체를 빌려서 되도록 많은 사람에게요

translation.en: I made this movie
because I love Phil…
because I love the life these tools allowed for me to have.
translation.ko: 툴 덕분에 제가 누리게 된 삶을 사랑하기 때문이에요

translation.en: And it doesn't matter what people think about the movie. It just matters that we finished it.
translation.ko: 대중이 어떻게 평가하든 우리가 영화를 완성한 게 중요해요

translation.en: Together.
Yeah, I feel closer to you now than when we started,
translation.ko: 맞아요, 시작할 때보다 조나와 더 친해진 것 같아요

translation.en: which I think is a great sign.
It's also great luck for me, you know, at age 74.
I love you.
I love you.
I still wish you would stop dumping so much shit on me.
translation.ko: 그래도 죽는소리는 그만 좀 하면 좋겠어요

translation.en: ♪ The last long day she said goodbye ♪ ♪ Well, Lord, I thought I would cry ♪
[Jonah] When we shot, like, months ago,
you had mentioned a relationship that was kind of on and off for a long time,
translation.ko: 오랫동안 만나다 말다 한 분이 계신다고 했잖아요

translation.en: and then you mentioned to me briefly in a phone call
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 저랑 잠깐 통화할 때

translation.en: how you had reached out to that person,
and I wanna ask you about it but only if you wanna talk about it.
translation.ko: 그 얘기를 여쭤보고 싶어요 대답하기 괜찮으시다면요

translation.en: It's so amazing.
This is-- She's the closest person in the world to me.
translation.ko: 그 여자는 이 세상에서 나와 제일 가까운 사람이죠

translation.en: Mostly, when we were younger, not wanting to be in a relationship,
translation.ko: 우리가 젊었을 때 사귀지 않으려 한 건

translation.en: mostly it was me.
I didn't have the will to make it work.
Now I do.
-Did you reach out after our conversation? -Yeah, it actually… it helped me. Yeah.
translation.ko: - 저랑 대화한 후에 연락하셨어요? - 네, 대화가 도움이 됐죠

translation.en: -Our conversation made me a bit ashamed. -[Jonah] In what way?
That I was doing something, like, without full commitment,
translation.ko: 내가 온 마음을 다해 행동하지 않았다는 사실이요

translation.en: like in a half-assed way.
So that was very helpful.
Who do you think's more scared of trying it out for real between you two?
translation.ko: 두 분 중에 누가 시도하기를 더 겁내신 것 같아요?

translation.en: You or her?
You think you'll be able to let down some walls
and put some fears aside to try, or you want to?
[splutters] Yeah, I'm going to. Yeah.
What would be the hopeful outcome?
The hopeful outcome is it works out.
That would be the hopeful outcome.
